amazing game, maybe 7 or 8/10 for new players, but definitely a 10/10 if you spend the time to really learn the game. no game i have ever played goes as in depth for so many different systems and mechanics that all intersect beautifully. the movement is top-notch, the melee combat smooth and satisfying, the gunplay is very fun and responsive, the wide array of different warframes to play as are individually unique and in-depth, and the upgrades systems for each are also very in-depth and compliment eachother well. the story and lore of warframe, while it may seem very minimal in the earlier hours of the game, is a major part of my personal enjoyment of the game. the biggest downside of the game, however, is the earliest hours of the game. the game itself does not do a very good job at teaching new players how the upgrades and damage systems work, and will require a lot of time either researching on the wiki, or being taught by veteran players. that being said, digital extremes have been including ways to streamline the path of the new player with their recent updates to the game such as adding a new quest that teaches new players about how to mod their weapons to deal specific damage types. warframe also has the most positive and new-player friendly community i have ever been a part of. veterans of the game (myself included) are very eager and happy to teach new players how to do everything that the game itself struggles to teach. but also be aware, there is a toxic side of the community, while it is small, they have become a little louder since people from the destiny 2 community are migrating to the warframe community.

warframe isn’t just a game it’s a masterpiece of modern sci-fi. the stunning visuals, fast and fluid movement, and deep combat system give players complete freedom to experiment. daily quests, co-op missions, and endless customization let you truly express yourself. clans, community events, and constant new content keep the game fresh no matter how long you play. in short, warframe perfectly blends action, strategy, and rpg elements—it’s absolutely amazing.

warframe — rise of the tenno across the stars warframe throws you into a breathtaking galaxy teeming with conflict, mystery, and opportunity. every mission, from stealthy infiltrations to high-octane battles, challenges players to master movement, timing, and strategy while navigating ever-changing environments. combat is exhilarating and precise. each warframe offers a distinct playstyle, and chaining abilities, acrobatics, and weapon combos turns even standard encounters into thrilling spectacles. elite missions and boss fights push players to think creatively and execute flawlessly, rewarding skill and adaptability. exploration is expansive and engaging. open-world hubs, hidden corridors, and procedurally generated events encourage curiosity and experimentation. frequent updates, limited-time events, and new missions ensure the experience remains fresh for both newcomers and veterans alike. progression is rich and satisfying. upgrading weapons, unlocking warframes, and customizing builds provides meaningful growth. cooperative multiplayer adds depth, allowing squads to combine powers and strategies for devastating effect, while solo players can also tackle challenges with careful planning and mastery. visually, warframe captivates with detailed sci-fi landscapes, fluid animations, and spectacular particle effects. the soundtrack and immersive sound design enhance the intensity of every mission, making exploration and combat feel cinematic and alive. final verdict: warframe is a thrilling, ever-evolving adventure that blends speed, strategy, and skillful combat. with endless customization, deep progression, and dynamic multiplayer, it offers a galaxy of challenges for any player willing to master its systems. "a fast, fluid, and endlessly exciting journey through a galaxy of combat and discovery." overall rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ 10/10

i started playing this game on sep 11, in that time i've racked up 225 hours of game play (as of this post). i honestly don't know why i had never heard of this game until this year. this is a sleeper and has so many things to offer: immersive story intense gameplay relaxing gameplay base building character design rogue lite rogue like not rogue anything space robot ninja wizards with lazer shotguns and quirky sidekicks puzzle games anti puzzle games the list goes on and on. moreover the community is very good at not giving out spoilers so you can ingest the game like it was brand new (or not, i'm not telling you how to play). there are many surprises and plenty of "wtf is going on here?!" moments that seemingly all get answered over time. finally, i'd like to say, you have not missed the boat on this one. there isn't a boat, it's a ferry going back and forth, and no matter when you start it's still the right time to start. that is, people who started when the game first came out aren't high-n-mighty about being the first, but are happy to see new players join their ever growing community. this game is my personal game of the year, even if i can't nominate it as such.

игра "i love you, colonel sanders! a finger lickin’ good dating simulator" — это, пожалуй, самое неожиданное и абсурдное творение, которое только можно себе представить. вы играете за студента кулинарного техникума, который должен выбрать свой путь, а именно – стать партнером легендарного полковника сандерса. графика в стиле ретро, простая, но очаровательная, создает атмосферу чего-то наивного и слегка безумного. диалоги полны юмора, зачастую довольно специфического, и отсылок к kfc. сами свидания с полковником – это отдельная история, полная неловких моментов, кулинарных вызовов и неожиданных поворотов. механика проста: выбирай ответы, развивай навыки и старайся понравиться полковнику. игра не претендует на глубину, но дарит массу смеха и позитивных эмоций. это идеальный выбор, если хочется чего-то легкого, забавного и совершенно несерьезного.

i love you, colonel sanders! a finger lickin’ good dating simulator is not a game, it's an e-book that's been dumped on steam masquerading as a game. as a visual/interactive novel, this doesn't feature any notable gameplay, it's just a lot of clicking through badly written dialogue that would never have been accepted or published in print, which poses the question, "how did something this badly written end up on steam?". when someone hoping to become an author is unable to get published in print, they spend $100 and dump their high school fan-fiction onto steam, under the guise of a game. i was wondering when this rather infamous marketing campaign from kfc would hit my queue. and here it is. it's not a game, first and foremost, it's a cyoa dating sim featuring col. harlan sanders, the bane of all chickens. this e-book was fronted on steam by kfc's marketing department, and unsurprisingly went slightly viral. so this is a parody of other e-books and the purpose is to sell fried chicken. e-books aren't games, and this fast food advertisement also isn't a game. even the noid game from dominos had gameplay. and, ultimately, this needs to be judged by the value it provides to pc gamers here on steam, and that is none. while this fast food advertisement e-book is "free", your gaming rig is not a kindle, and we deserve better than having steam be used as a tool of the marketing arms of global corporations. it's impossible for me to recommend things to pc gamers that aren't really games.

who knew that the colonel’s secret recipe wasn’t just for fried chicken, but for winning my heart? from the very first bite... i mean, date, you’ll find yourself locked in a high-stakes culinary romance. as you cook your way into colonel sanders' heart. by the end, you might be questioning your life choices, but you’ll definitely be craving a bucket of fried chicken. is it love? is it food? is it both? honestly, yes. yes, it is.

this visual novel is the perfect example of why i don't like reading visual novels "for the meme." i'm all for comedy-heavy visual novels, but this kfc game feels like a big franchise owned by boomers trying to cater to lazy, lame zoomer "meme" humor. and well, it's not great. once you get over the "lol, the characters are attracted to colonel sanders" gimmick, there's literally nothing memorable about it. the characters are just one-trick pony gimmick jokes that aren't funny, lack charm, and have super forgettable personalities. the only positives i can give are that it's free and takes less than two hours to read in full. so at least if you don't like it, you didn't lose anything monetarily. this isn't the worst or most unfunny visual novel i've ever read; i'll still take this humor over the cringe-fest of alcot, chuablesoft, favorite, feng, and some parts of yuzusoft titles. however, this does not make it an actual funny game by any means. it has a lame "tryhard" comedy style that i don't recommend to anyone except those with godawful taste in gen z-style memes.

jugué la primera entrega de insurgency y me encantó por completo. sus modos de juego, el ritmo, ese equilibrio entre arcade y realismo me parecieron una experiencia única dentro de los shooters en primera persona. insurgency: sandstorm mantiene ese mismo espíritu, pero elevando todo a otro nivel. gráficamente es muy superior, el sonido es espectacular cada disparo, cada explosión se sienten intensamente reales y la jugabilidad sigue siendo su punto más fuerte.este no es un shooter para cualquiera. tiene un enfoque más táctico y realista que call of duty, pero no llega a los extremos de simulación de arma, quedando justo en ese punto medio que lo hace tan especial. su gunplay es excelente, el arsenal está muy bien trabajado, y los mapas y modos están diseñados para ofrecer combates intensos, inmersivos y llenos de tensión. si encajas con este estilo de juego, es muy probable que te quedes por decenas o incluso cientos de horas. y aunque no seas ese jugador “ideal”, sandstorm sigue ofreciendo razones de sobra para jugarlo, sobre todo si tienes amigos con quienes compartir la **** definitiva, lo recomiendo sin dudar por su jugabilidad, por el realismo bien medido, por sus gráficos mejorados y por su sonido impresionante. un multijugador diferente que merece más atención de la que tiene.

just like my favorite game of all time l4d2 this game is extremely replayable the community might be toxic to certain people yes i can see that but i love them i interact with some of the same people here and there and they give me a good laugh. the game gets updates pretty frequently for things like cosmetics, maps, double xp (for account level) it doesn't let the game hang out to dry like what rockstar games did to red dead redemption 2 mp. the reason i put it as a 9/10 instead of a 10/10 is phasing issues when i shoot someone sometimes the bullet goes through them and hits behind them and there's a weird bug recently i've recently got in the pass few days of ground texture being black but it stops when the game is done, none the less if i had 30 bucks and trying to get an fps that will last me a long time, if im looking for a game that isn't cod, rainbow 6, and im not looking for a game like ready or not/arma/squad, this is the game!!!
a perfect blend of gritty realism with nice arcadey elements that make for a wonderful serious game, and a wonderful 'lets **** around' game at the same time.
it just feels like a copy and past of other fps games ive played. it doesn't stand out i and is just another multiplayer fps game. its pretty good, but just nothing special.ndependently
really great game. i like the realism, especially shotguns. not that many games get it right. good comms with teammates.

love the realism and attention to detail in graphics, animations, and mechanics! although i like it being sort of an arcade game, the optimization does ruin the gameplay but the game is fun generally.
best arcade and sim shooter to this day

the performance eventually became stable by 2022. overall, they found a balance between hardcore simulators and arcade fun. all weapons are available from the first level, but it takes time to find your most suitable options and set of mods. the death is a matter of a couple of hits or one headshot, but it will not be easy to land those shots. updates are relatively rare, but there are funky game modes in rotation that change every two weeks.

a way more strategical take on the cod / bf / cs formula. the time to kill is extremely low making any weapon viable and making the game more about strategy and reflexes. sadly there is no real progression system. due to that many players quit and the player number are rather low.

absolutely do not recommend this game. because it has two useless classes - the observer, who is always running wherever and does not fulfill his functions and the commander, who can do nothing because he is fully dependent on the observer, who is running wherever!

it was a good game with good gunfight and has bot to play offline which very hard to find now a day. however after devs decide to improve enemy bots and make it a terminator with aimbot at every range game become frustrate to play in local play
compared to most modern shooters its decent but the slow pacing and unusable explosives ruin the game for hardcore players. here's what im talking about: ****/oqosmratxus
no dedicated servers, means you can only play with randoms and strangers and have basically zero control about anything.
the game is absolute dogs**t. you wait more to respawn than that you actually play the game. all the game modes are also terrible. would refund immediately if i could.

please be aware the player reviews are populated with people from india and shri lanka payed to write reviews. this game is not good or finished. extremely underdeveloped and lazy, the game feels like a highly polished gmod gamemode than an actually released video game. it's extremely disappointing to see that both aaa developers and indie devs can be so lazy and greedy. do not buy this game, it is ugly, boring, unbalance and rife with toxic players and cheaters.

to much lag random freeze servers are not the best in my country the devs don't care on fixing the game and give dlc updates every now and then with small improvements on things that should have been there in the beginning the only reason for you to buy it is if u planning to play.coop with friends but buy it only if you know they will play with you cose if they don't don't bother

looks great, adds new gameplay features, and generally improves the gameplay. but the balance and knowledge on weapons is completely out of whack. some guns are just objectively better than others with no regards to what their actual performance is. case and point is the as val. it somehow does less damage than 9x19mm, despite shooting 9x39mm. they've **** up things with weapon details before. it seems like they're a bunch of tactics nerds wanting to make shooting games.
constant suttering and lagging even freezing in firefights this is on medium i have a 1700x amd 480 it shouldnt happen with 60fps

i was really looking forward to playing this game and it seem like a fun game when i tried it. but the performance is the worst i have ever experienced in any game. despite barley using a third of my cpu and gpu processing power the game runs a a very unstable 70 fps on the lowest possible settings (i easily get 160 fps on high setting in much more demanding games) on top that there is constant lag. it’s a pity, it seems like a cool game and it would be nice to see a small studio make something great. but the performance is truly abysmal

this game is full of fun! great references from starship troopers. well it is based on the movie or more likely on the book. shooting is great, enemies, tactics, all the ways how to achieve victory for democracy is flawless. even more fun with friends or just randomly join other players. this game has very friendly and funny **** only flaw might be getting new guns, getting some standard pieces is not a problem, but for other bundles with skins, emotes, guns etc., you need to either buy game credit or spend some time in the game in order to find these credits. in my case, i spent around 45 hours before i got enough credits for new bundle. game credits are not that easy to find and you will find just a few of them per game.
super chill player base and the most toxic-free online game i’ve ever played. has some performance issues they’re still working through.

gra jest świetna oczywiście rozgrywa fajna i zabawna, ale trzeba grać z kolegami bo inaczej dosyć szybko sie nudzi. jedynej rzeczy jakiej brakuje mi w tej grze to nic innego jak więcej graczy i większe mapy.
surprisingly, this is a lot of fun. i was gifted this game by a friend so we could play together. it's pretty straightforward; point and shoot!

possibly the worst optimization i've ever seen in a game, i had to install a third-party program just to allow the game to run smoothly without crashing or lagging. that's my only complaint with the game, besides that, it's one of the best games i've ever played and the devs are amazing.
this is an amazing experience running on all cylnders constantly. it is an immersive experience and on that was realized perfectly inline with its vision.

legendary game with great detailing. really fun co-op and non-repetitive gameplay since you can unlock more things as you go on and fight with different loadouts every time. lost 1 point because of some still existing bugs and physics glitches, but that makes it more fun sometimes in multiplayer.

this game is a lot of fun for many hours, especially while discovering the different factions and difficulty levels. in-game events happen regularly, adding new enemies, new missions, and community objectives to complete within a limited time. however, there are also frequent bugs — some funny, like enemies dying and suddenly flying off into the sky, and others less amusing, like game crashes or your character getting randomly launched across the map with all their ****’s perfectly playable solo, but i think the experience is much more enjoyable with friends.
it's fun. it's fun !that's something you don't see these days very often. and it's not even that expensive.

what started as one of the most fun experiences of the modern gaming generation was stunted by a former dev team that doubled down on their questionable decisions. now heralded by a dev team that appears to prioritize enjoyment and game feel, the game is back to what it was at the start. mindless fun that you could log into for a couple of hours and enjoy with friends. the movement sometimes clunky, the bugs infuriating, and the friendly fire always hilarious. if you're a fan of action multiplayer games that are pve(or pvp depending on how your allies are feeling), then this game is one you shouldn't miss.

helldivers 2 is a masterpiece in the action and cooperative shooter genre, bringing the gaming experience to a new generation with its stunning blend of strategy, teamwork, and adrenaline. the community is active, and there are always teammates ready to fight by your side. moreover, the extensive character customisation and progression options provide excellent motivation to keep playing and improving. in short, it's a cracking game—the kind that only comes around every 15 or 20 years.

seems amazing at first, has a ton of great gameplay and is maybe some of the coolest friendslop out there. the problem is the performance. i love this game but ive been unable to play it for months because it has ridiculous audio and visual bugs that no other software on my device has any issues with. it's just lazy greedy devs at this point, and you should not trust them.

really, really bad game. low quality slop, plain and bland extraction shooter mechanics, and a boring gameplay loop. the community is toxic (they basically put a gun to your head and say “waste $40 and play this, now like it or die”). the community is also full of “free-thinking” chuds that imitate all the popular opinions spread around the internet by gaming influencers, eg. “women are bad”, “lgbtq ****”, “white men are sigma”. 1/10, the only good thing about this game are the graphics.

absolute gutter trash, hunters are heat seeking missiles, even if you dive while they're in mid air their trajectory will change mid flight in order to get a free hit on you. also if you're not running an anti armor build you're guaranteed failure. you have to bring thermite grenades, you have to have a rocket launcher of some sort for the infinite number of chargers that will come at you. a flea bite kills you, constant crashes, pointless mission time limits and useless currency you'll already have maxed out because there's no longer anything useful to buy. best of all sometimes your character will refuse to use healing items irregardless if you're button mashing the heal button. sometimes the game just decides you have to die. lazy, boring, untested, micro transaction begging scum

an originally goty contender is up in smokes. i'm going to be always skeptical of sony entertainment games with this whole fiasco. and honestly this makes me thinking of deleting my psn account and selling my ps5 **** game itself is fun but from this whole fiasco, both dev and publisher have to have better communications and ensure the same level of screw up doesn't occur again. i can't even play with my online friends as they are from a "psn not available in your region" region.this also makes me not ever gonna buy any more sony playstation published games and have ignored sony playstation games in all platforms now.

while the core gameplay is extremely fun, the game is plagued by sever (and ever growing with each new patch) performances issues. while i can still play with 60 fps (half of what i had a year ago) my friends can't and gave up on the game. unfortunately the devs seems more eager to release new content and adding to the never ending list of bugs and broken mechanics (like the stun weapons that don't work as intended because of bugs that have been present since the game's release), than fixing their game and making it enjoyable for everyone, which is not very democratic. no matter how fun the gameplay loop is, undemocratic behaviour deserve a 0.
impossible de jouer au jeu sans faire un millard de manipulation dans les fichier du jeux et du pc apres 1 an ca devrait deja etre reglé!
this game is full of bugs and crashes. the balancing update is really funny. but overall, it's gameplay is fundamentally great.

one of the greatest games in the roguelike genre. on par with such giants as hades, tboi and dead cells. the music is excellent and suits the game very well, the visuals are pleasant and understandable, the plot is a bit weak, but not bad at all, the replayability is cosmic, and the variety is huge. an amazing game. i understand those people who have more than 500 hours, 1k hours and more in it. the game is 5 years old since its release, and i still enjoy coming back to it. the community of this game has not disappointed either. they make funny memes and excellent mods with guides. what more could you want from dedicated fans? in co-op, the game reveals its full potential.

an absolute game masterpiece. despite some minor conflicts, like regarding early seekers of the storm dlc, it is still a masterpiece. lore is tragic and well-made, secrets are secret enough and game is actually challenging. so i would recommend it to anyone. literally.

risk of rain 2 has become one of my favorite games of all time i have 560 hours in the game and once the next dlc comes out i plan on playing it for even more the game has so many characters items and maps to master, there is a reason why this game has such a massive fan base even 5 years since it came out once you pick it up

très bon jeu, avec un système de difficulté augmentant avec le temps, et non le niveau dans lequel vous êtes. on voit au fur et a mesure de la partie son build devenir de plus en plus fort, avec une multitude de synergies disponibles, ce qui est très plaisant. les differents personnages disponibles offrent tous un gameplay different, chacun ayant sa facon de tirer, ses propres capacités, assurant une très bonne rejouabilité. j'ai joué la majorité du temps en multijoueur, et c'est une superbe expérience, parfois hilarante quand votre ami oblitère tout sur son passage. si vous aimez les roguelikes, il est impératif de jouer a ce jeu.
of any rougelike, this one does it the best, with every run being a unique experience and every other aspect being perfected as well

a very good game with a bunch of surprises packing, i like how the difficulty increases as you go on making it harder & more worth it if you like intense 3rd person shooters, its controls are a little janky but overall, a good game.

proud ameri̇cans!! pros: intense atmosphere - realistic gunplay - teamwork is crucialcons: steep learning curve - outdated visuals - not newbie-friendly rising storm 2: vietnam stands out among war games with its emphasis on realism and tactical depth. it’s not the most accessible title, but once mastered, it offers a deeply satisfying and immersive experience. the game captures the chaos of the vietnam war with great authenticity—from the crack of gunfire to the intensity of large-scale firefights. teamwork is absolutely crucial, as success depends more on coordination than individual skill. while its dated visuals and steep difficulty may deter newcomers, players who enjoy a strategic and realistic fps will find rs2 vietnam to be a uniquely rewarding experience.
very good game. i enjoyed playing this game a lot. i strongly recommend this.

this game is really fantastic. it's the game battlefield wants to be. it's tough and will kick your ass, but it's such a blast to play. it's not perfect. the game never feels "stable," and stuff like ping is constantly all over the place across the board. but it doesn't really detract from the experience too much. it's really a good time. there are some aspects that aren't ideal. the community is pretty toxic at times, but it's not something that plagues the entire player base. there are also a lot of classes where you will not be able to play 99% of the time. a lot of the classes can only have a certain amount of people select it at once, and it's based on a mostly first come, first serve basis around how quickly you load into the game. if you don't have the best ssd & setup, prepare to play rifleman and whatnot most of the time. even then, it's still great fun.
если бы ленивые разрабы не ленились со своими кривыми руками и мизерными бюджетами допилить ихру то это была бы просто пушшка брат аа

some folks are born made to wave the flag ooh, they're red, white and blue and when the band plays hail to the chief ooh, they point the cannon at you, lord it ain't me, it ain't me i ain't no senator's son, son it ain't me, it ain't me i ain't no fortunate one, no buen juego, malos servidores, es como una mezclas entre el realismo de arma con lo arcade de battlefield.

the most realistic war based, tactical fps ive ever seen. you can die and kill in one shot. due to its realistic nature, many first timers get killed without even knowing where the enemy is. it does have a steep learning curve. when i first started this game out, i was running everywhere, not being too wary of oncoming fire, because i was used to cod. this is nothing like it. you have to move slowly to not catch a snipers eye. teamkilling happens often, to everyone. just apologize

another solid and intense shooter from tripwire. has a couple of little weird bugs and frame rate issues but overall if you have enjoyed red orchestra and are looking for something with enough difference this is worth a look.

this is hands down the best fps game released since battlefield 2142 (maybe battlefield 3 at a push). a game for the proper gamer, where a modern call of duty approach of 'spray & pray' will be met with a swift bullet to the head at 50meters! if you are considering purchasing and are exacerbated by the ever reducing quality and dumbing down of games (cod, battlefield 4, v etc..) then please give this a shot! the realism is top notch and the mechanics are very balanced. yes it is challenging, but it makes it all more the satisfying when you manage to get a kill on the other team! those that have been negative about this game i would lump with the idiots that ruin modern mainstream games these days :(

solid all around shooter, very fun to play online in large scale battles. a great representation of the vietnam war. team work is key, had a blast playing online with friends several hours of fun and frustration. great online shooter with a multiplayer campaign mode, large selection of classes, weapons, and tools. pretty solid graphics and mechanics, def a must buy fr anyone that like large scale open battles with multiple objectives.
pretty fun shooter to just pop in and play for an hour or so. fairly cheap, too. good if you're looking for something slightly more tactical than cod or just a vietnam game

the gameplay itself is not that bad... but the developers made very dumb choices regarding the game. for example the cartoonish style of the characters (yet it's supposed to be a game where it feels like real war) , only few maps are actually good and therefore played by the users while the other maps are basically never voted (at the end of the match the players must vote for a map). for some reason, the developers implemented the possibility to chat with the enemy team... without being able to mute users tho, so far too often you will encounter toxic users on the enemy team who spams insults ruining the game experience. shame as it could have been far better.
imagine vietnam war but you have severe cerebral palsy and a russian guy shoves **** at your face.
good idea, but trash execution. buggy and clunky gameplay, **** audio design and really bad class system.
no single player mode in the f***ot game. i'm glad i didn't pay for this crap.

rising storm 2 is one of the best, while one of the worst multiplayer games i've ever played! combat, gameplay, pace, maps, guns, sound, and community are awsome. servers, graphics, and animation ****! gameplay- its just divine, you feel like you are really in the war, and you can't just run for the objective, you need to be careful, cooperate with your teammates. the shots feel real, and every decision you make will have an impact (good or bad). the community always tries to help and is respectful. now the bad points: graphics and animations- they look kinda bad and outdated, even for a 2017 game, i mean, its unreal engine 3 and there are a lot of visual bugs. servers- now, this is the big problem: the worst servers i've seen in my entire life (including mw)... the game is free right now, and 20k people are playing the game, but it cant handle such amount of people! my question is: if they cant handle 20k players, why is it free? i mean, it is just a dumb move, and no one will want to return to the game, and it will die again... i can't find servers and the servers that are not full have 200 ping. everyone complaining about how poorly made the game is... and the **** menu and settings littrelay broke i can't make sound lower and the browser sistem just stops working sometimes (2000 games problems) 3/10 (i hope all of this gets better after everyone stops playing)

изначально брал в стиме с последующим рефандом т.к. система "на ключевых ролях пусть играют отборные тупицы" мне не зашла. сейчас получил в эпике нахаляву и не опленился зайти в надежде что чето поменялось. не поменялось - как была год назад фуфлом так и осталась. хотя система отсеивания нубья с ролей прям сама напрашивается - если ты за простого пехотинца покажешь результат - допускаешься к очереди на роль. но видимо эта простейшая концепция противоречит веселому духу игры для отбросов на главных ролях.
had some pretty bad first time experience. this game is almost unplayable for me. i7 and a 1080ti and yet finding servers to hold a framerate is a major problem...

awful, probably the worst shooter i've ever played. the whole experience - get killed over and over in one shot when you have no idea where the fire is coming from as everything looks like a blobby green mess.

i've got no problem with unforgiving games, but this game gives you literally nothing. there's a really steep learning curve, and really no reason to do it. the gameplay isn't unique. the maps are boring and straight up poorly designed, and the hitboxes and general controls just feel sloppy. if you like it, you like it, but there are many objectively better shooters out. it's just not fun.
critical bugs are killing the game: 'connection to the server has been lost' unranked bug, and when dying the dshk weapons disappear. needs another big patch from the devs.

very generic, mediocre shooter that is saved by its green army man mode. otherwise avoid this. it's buggy, the community of this game is toxic (not in just a gameplay either.. ran into so many bigots in this game... [is the game even being moderated at all????!?!??]), and the regular mp/campaign modes really just ****. --got this with my humble monthly subscription--

post void is a very very fun, very fast-paced fps arcade ish game. short but really fun and gets intense on the later levels. now is one of my games that i love to pick up and blast through some deranged looking enemies with an uzi that bounces off the wall and explodes in impact, what a game. i love pew pew shoot things 7.7/10
for only being about $3 this game is great! very fast paced and really cool visuals. my favourite thing about this game is the art style. it's a very short game but priced accordingly.

awesome and game!!! super adrenaline, lysergic and pulp with an exceptional art style and gunplay and a really raw, dirty rock&roll soundtrack... to be accompanied by some guitar wolf listening...love it!!!
the time is post void the place is post void and this game its pretty insane

the game is extremely fun and addictive with great replayability and a clear goal in mind but even with this in mind i do wish there was more diversity between runs being more types of upgrades between levels and different weapons. even so this game is great with out them and is one of the best things you can do with $5 (australian)
post void succeeds in being one of the most pulse pounding and hectic games i've ever played. good
probably the best way to spent your 2 dollars( dont eat that twix bar you pig buy this game instead) fast paced shooting with some grotesque enemies and hard as **** gameplay awww yeaah
[post void] is a fantastic yet ultimately too short fps experience. i would highly recommend [post void] yet it will definitely leave you wanting more.

gritty, raw, and unforgiving. post void is a perfect example of art direction and gameplay meeting abrasively (in the best way) to create a unique and whole experience. better move at a break-neck speed and hit shots with pinpoint accuracy or you'll never reach the end. this was the most fun i've had playing a game in a long time, can't recommend enough.
this is a very addictive fast pace game and the art style looks like you just took acid

turbo overkill is an excellent game that doesn't shy away from sending dopamine directly to your brain, i surprised myself playing the game over and over again without really thinking about it. the weapon roaster is extremely enjoyable to shoot and gibbing the enemies is music to my ears. overall it's a more than competent game and civvie should play part 2.

good side -comfortable character control and fast fighting system. -a story that does not take itself seriously is an aspect that makes me happy. -boss battles are good. -level design diversifies and develops in later sections. -you can shape your play style with the new cybernetic and weapon modes that open. -beautiful music. bad side -level design is shallow at the beginning. -the feeling of hitting is weak. -some weapons are both weak and meaningless. -the visuals sometimes hurt your eyes. according to 2025
this game is like low budget doom. i liked it but after a while it gets repetitive and boring.

hits hard, with killer gameplay and legit boomer shooter gunplay that reminds me of what the genre is all about. i don't play these games for the story or the visuals - i play them for the fun factor, and turbo overkill (for the most part...) excels. episode 1: 10/10 episode 2: 7/10 episode 3: 3/10 might just be an example of too much being a bad thing, but by the time i hit ep3 i was kinda over it. levels are all a bit long and my god these final boss fights are rough, with punishing lack of checkpoints etc. still i'd say the fights are fun as hell, with all the movement tech the game provides coupled with furious guns blazing. worth a play. just be prepared to wonder how long the ride is going to last. oh and why the fk is there a sniper in a retro shooter? and why in the fk are there multiple segments dedicated to it?

uff, es un juego increíble.tiene una historia minimalista, pero llena de personajes y de humor. el combate es extremadamente satisfactorio, tienes una serie de diversas armas para diferentes situaciones y con distintas habilidades que mejoras mientras juegas. también obtienes distintos elementos de tu equipo que te ayuda en la movilidad, así como en el **** diseño de niveles es excelente en su mayoría, hay uno que otro nivel que puede durar un poco más tiempo del que uno quiere y despúes hay otros que intentan diversificar las cosas añadiendo vehiculos y cosas así; algunos de estos ultimos funcionan bien, otros -en mi opinión-, no **** grafícas son bastante particulares, mezclan entre sprites, así como arte en tercera dimensión, eso sin contar lo bueno que es la banda sonora.además, el juego tiene muchos secretos, modos de juegos extra, distintos trucos que uno puede desbloquear por medio de secretos, así como la habilidad de siempre poder volver a jugar cualquier nivel manteniendo su progreso; tiene un sistema universal de desbloqueo, entonces uno puede jugar el primer nivel con todas las armas y mejoras del ultimo, por ejemplo. si no te gusta esto, siempre puedes empezar desde cero borrando tu **** general, es un juego de los mejores del género de disparos que han salido en epocas recientes.

i have not finished this game but i just really felt i had to say a few things about it.this is one of the greatest examples of what a small new studio with a brand new ip and a very limited budget can do when time and opportunity is given to people with incredible talent and video game design understanding. i have played so many shooters from huge aaa titles to aa to indies and truly very few can come even close to how this game is managing to capture the old school boomer shooter aesthetic while at the same time looking super modern and have amazing graphics. the combat is just so fast, so satisfying with some of the most spot on sound design and fps mechanics i've ever experienced.
it is the most fun i've had in a very long time plain and simple nothing more to it.

really fun boomer shooter, where every weapon is fun to shoot, the enemies are varied enough to be interesting and the arena levels are okay. level design is very poor, sadly, with unclear directions and it' frequently difficult to understand what the game wants from you. the ammo and health distribution is also an issue, there is no reliable way to get these from the enemies, unless they are fodder enemies. so it's not quite doom eternal level combat and some opponents fall into the bullet sponge category, but that's a small issue, since the game provides really fun weapons to engage with them.
amazing retro style fps. hadn't had a fill of adrenaline like this since i finished doom eternal. super recommended game!
turbo overkill aka chainsaw man the game 10/10.

haven't had this much fun since ultrakill and doom eternal. the game looks amazing despite it's pixelated models, and the gunplay feels amazingly fun. when people say "chainsaw man", the first thing that comes to mind is turbo overkill.

great world-building. fantastic music. creative level design. they nailed the feel of bouncing around in games like quake, and built a genuinely creepy and fun game around it. my main complaint is that some weapons are objectively much better than others, so as things get harder you pretty quickly get forced into using the same couple of weapons while ignoring the rest. the games of this genre that i've enjoyed the most have revolved around switching between well-balanced weapons to take advantage of their various strengths, but that aspect just isn't here. still a great game.
one of the best boomer shooters of nowadays. some levels have pretty meh level design, but that's it!

after a little over 3 hours on dusk, with having finished the first episode; i could confirm this game is incredible. the presentation is on point! the sound design, the soundtrack, the colour grading and general art style sells you the game's rural horror lovecraftian-ish **** combat design too are amazing. it took everything that made quake worked and made it it's own thing! from the non-linear level design as well as the enemy boss fight **** easy 10/10 from me. an amazing addition to my gaming library, and a must-play for any fan of boomer shooters.

it's a cool game. pros.: - old-school vibe and aesthetics. - references to quake (first one) and blood. - creative levels. especially in episode 3. - plenty of secrets. cons.: - idk. most of the things are cool. music is fine. probably, sounds are too primitive sometimes.

great boomer shooter. big variety of weapons, memorable enemies and levels. this is clearly a work of passion and talent, everything pieces together perfectly. if you feel like you might like it from the trailer you will most definitely love it, it's pretty straight forward. i had to cut one point because there are parts of the game that didn't click for me. sometimes i got lost in the level and wasn't sure how to progress, but not for long fortunately. the flipping mechanic is very confusing with the perspective change on the camera. there were also certain spots where the enemies would get stuck, but not too many. these are all just nitpicks. this game is absolutely gorgeous.

incredible indie game, it has a high resemblance to doom, even the keys, red, yellow and blue are present. i love the originality of this game! engaging and haunting soundtrack, horror/horror game is only really good when it has these 90s graphics, i also love the amount of bodies that are on the ground, the violence, an almost perfect game!

overall a very fun, unique and interesting experience. the world of s#*t city is pungent, and fits exceptionally well with its art style (both in game and within the intro cutscene and accompanying art), atmosphere, tone and, best of all, the soundtrack. gameplay is engaging. as you progress and complete challenges within missions, you acquire a new pair of trainers which give you modifiers which range from a second life, explosions when you kick doors, giving enemies big heads, etc. it bodes well for replayability. the game at its core isn’t so challenging, but when going for the challenge stars, it makes the game a lot more difficult. the thing i like the most about this game is the artstyle, music, atmosphere and setting, i think it all fits together exceptionally well, and gives a breath of fresh air to the genre. a unique experience, and something that will stay in my mind for a while. highly recommend if you enjoy underground counterculture, pungent violence, somewhat challenging gameplay, and rave music

this game reminds me a lot of the ghostrunner series where it's definitely a first person shooter/melee game but it's less about just shooting your way through levels and more about being precise. feels more like a puzzle game to an extent than just a straightforward shooter. definitely a game where it's all about trial and error and you will absolutely have to play a level multiple times to get your run down perfect. a little frustrating because of this and because it feels like a grind and i constantly feel like even if i am doing well i could get killed going through a new doorway and have to restart the whole level all over again. the music is great and it is kind of a ridiculous concept of the world run by gangs and you being the one guy who's not in a gang. gameplay is super solid though which is bringing me back into it for sure. the random driving mechanics they threw in to the last two levels of the game totally threw me off and they were not intuitively controlled at all and that dropped the score for me because a solid shooter became a janky drive fest in the very last stretch of the game.
very fun game. very punishing and hard as well, but still very unique. can recommend!!!!

(my score : 7.9 /10) fast-paced action game that is exciting and quite challenging! combat in this game, apart from shooters using pistols or guns with limited ammunition, we can also rely on kicks with feet which we can wear with shoes or sandals, which we can unlock with the number of stars we get in each stage. there are 5 areas that must be passed on the **** city map to complete this game, including: the violence gang (15 stage + boss), the pollution gang (13 stage + boss), the business gang (15 stage + boss), the debauchery gang (13 stages + boss), crime tower (4 stages + boss). list of boss i faced: goocopkopter / goocopbomber / 1997 lucida. the sludge baron / the unflushable / the filth mind. the ceo / mega ceo / mecha ceo. pizza pig / unholy corpulence / spider pig. the crime minister. there are 2 endings in this game, namely bad and true ending. bad ending if we choose to accept the crime minister's offer to join and enjoy nice city by kicking premium sneakers into the fire. or choose premium sneakers and kick the crime minister! (true ending).

anger foot" is a frenetic, adrenaline-packed first-person shooter that excels in delivering pure, unadulterated fun. with its dynamic combat, vibrant world, and engaging soundtrack, it's a must-play for fans of high-energy shooters. despite its over-the-top style and challenging gameplay, the game offers high replayability and endless thrills. - read the full review @ digitalcritiq dot com

like the first hotline miami, but 3d. better movement, gameplay and control that most of the doom/quake-like out there. the music its great, like in hotline, without the music this game wouldn`t be half of what it is. good art style, coherent with its setting and story. can replay the levels multiples times to get all stars and not feel discouraged in failure. however, once completed in full, there`s nothing that makes you try again. what`s the problem about this? the game is short already, and the full levels don`t add much time of play to the pool. the game is short. i want more, and i wish they have added a map editor.

i'm gonna begin with a question. do you like doom or doom eternal ? yes ? then stop reading and buy that game i m m e d i a t e l y. ultrakill is an awesome game that will ask all of your focus to be fun, you will need to not be interrupted to get the best experience. i won't spoil the game here, however, after playing it and playing another game, even doom, you feel what i call the "ultrakill syndrome". what's the ultrakill syndrome ? well it makes you feel like you're slow as hell everywhere, in every games. because ultrakill is the fastest game i've ever played, while doom eternal can be considered as a fast fps, ultrakill is an ultrafast fps.

while dusk looks like the first doom this ultrakill looks like doom 2016. if you have a pc that doesn't run doom 2016 you can buy ultrakill because it is the closest game that exists to the most modern doom. i'm only giving it a 9 because it's a hard game to master even on easy

un juego simple con una mecánica innovadora y una historia también simple pero que te **** hubiera gustado que agregaran mas mecánicas o mas cosas en general pero este juego no necesita ser tan grande, de hecho su simpleza es lo que lo hace brillar aparte de que puedes jugar el sh:mcd y el vr, el juego base en si no es que lo jugaría por horas (para eso prefiero severed steel) en realidad lo que me gusta de superhot es su historia mas que el gameplay en si, además de que algunos niveles se me hacian un poco injustos poniendo muchos enemigos que te disparan por todos lados al mismo tiempo y te dejan sin muchas opciones, además de que no puedes mirar a tu alrededor ya que esto supondría que el tiempo avance y por ende mueras, sin embargo es muy satisfactorio cuando completas el nivel y lo ves todo en velocidad normal. un juego con una historia muy original y el shooter mas innovador que he jugado en años.

superhot — это необычный шутер, который выделяется своим уникальным игровым процессом. идея того, что время движется только тогда, когда двигаешься ты, заставляет продумывать каждый шаг и делает игру похожей на своеобразную стратегию в реальном времени. атмосфера минимализма и яркий визуальный стиль тоже играют свою роль: красные враги на фоне белого окружения смотрятся стильно и придают всему происходящему особый шарм.но, несмотря на оригинальность, есть моменты, которые могут надоесть. кампания довольно короткая, а после прохождения основного сюжета остается не так много причин возвращаться. кроме того, сама концепция замедления времени интересна, но в какой-то момент она перестает быть чем-то необычным и превращается в рутину.в итоге superhot — это отличная игра для пары вечеров, но ее идеи не раскрываются в полной мере. если вам интересен необычный взгляд на жанр шутеров, то она стоит внимания, но не ждите слишком глубокого опыта. 7 из 10.
difícil a ratos, mucho contenido y una historia muy bien contada pero difícil de encontrar

i can't believe i wasted my time on this. superhot is a total letdown. the "time moves when you move" mechanic gets old so fast, and the gameplay becomes a repetitive slog. the story is non-existent, the graphics are painfully dull, and there’s nothing here to keep you engaged for more than an hour. this game is overrated, and i can’t understand why anyone would recommend it. if you’re thinking about buying it, save yourself the frustration and look elsewhere. 2/10.

first off, let me just say that this game is a ******* nightmare. the whole concept of time only moving when you do sounds intriguing on paper, but in execution, it's just a headache-inducing mess. trying to strategize and plan your moves while everything is frozen in place is enough to make anyone want to pull their hair out. and don't even get me started on those damn red men. they pop up out of nowhere, relentless in their pursuit to take you down. it felt like no matter what i did, they were always one step ahead, ready to dish out another frustrating defeat. in conclusion, "superhot" is a frustrating, infuriating mess **** that i would not recommend to my worst enemy. save yourself the headache and the rage-inducing moments, and spend your time playing something actually enjoyable. trust me, you'll thank me later.

legends of runeterra is a brilliantly designed online trading card game. most importantly, lor innovates game mechanics with a back-and-forth format that objectively make this game more tactical (but maybe less beginner-friendly) than its peers (like hearthstone). with most actions that a player takes, the opponent has an option to respond, which often results in chains of actions with sometimes incredible comebacks/upsets. the artwork and animations are stellar, and the universe the game takes place in is advantaged by a rich legacy lore due to the producer's other products like league of legends and arcane. the game offers an incredible and near-endless pve experience in addition to pvp: in fact, pvp has sadly taken a back-seat in the last couple years but is by no means dead as matches only take minutes to find. the future is difficult to predict and i hope that pvp will grow more as my heart will always be in pvp gameplay. perhaps the most admirable quality of this game is its refusal to be "pay-to-win" as free cards and resources are given generously and consistently so that any player looking to play competitively can do so free of financial cost if they desire, at least for pvp. and that is something hearthstone cannot boast.

a big problem i had was the card picking. depending on your starting hand, and how you play it, will the computer "choose" the cards you pick up in your deck, i find in most cases. so at that point, it's only strategic for like, the first 25% of the round, and the next 5 - 7 mins is just the computer stalling to make the game longer, regardless of whether you are winning or losing. i felt this isn't an actual card game because you don't get your cards by chance, but the cards you pick up are heavily influenced by the (winning/losing) stance you are in (losing = **** cards each round, winning = stronger cards each round), the probability of getting certain cards is sealed depending on whether you are winning or losing, unlike real card games, the chance of getting any card is always 1 / total number of cards.

hikayesiyle, oynanışıyla, sanat tasarımıyla, şarkılarıyla, ses tasarımıyla çok güzel tam paket bir oyun. oynanış jrpg tarzına parry ekleyerek çok güzel bir tat katıyor. jrpg kısmının derinliği aşırı değil ama gayet yeterli ve oyun boyunca sizi tutabiliyor. parry sistemi de jrpg'lerin kaçınılmaz olarak düştüğü tekrardan kurtarıyor. normalde jrpg'lerde bir yerden sonra ekrana bile bakmadan oynarsınız. i̇sterse persona olsun ister sea of stars olsun, en iyisi bile bir yerden sonra eksik kalır. ancak bu oyun o sınıra çarpsa da parry sistemi sürekli odaklı kalmanızı sağlıyor. oynanış kısmında tek sıkıntı diyebileceğim kısım level scaling olmaması. yan görevlere falan giderseniz çok güçleniyorsunuz ve ana hikayede her şeye tek atar hale geliyorsunuz. yan içeriklerde gücünüze uygun düşmanlar var ancak ana hikaye seviyenizin çok gerisinde kalıyor. oynayacaksanız önce ana hikayeyi bitirip sonra yan görevlere gitmeyi düşünebilirsiniz. hikayesi çok güzel, hiç spoiler vermeyeyim ilk kez oynarken deneyimleyin. sadece şunu söyleyeyim hikaye olay örgüsü olarak bence süper değil ancak karakterler asıl lezzeti veren şey. sanat tasarımı, ses tasarımı zaten harika. oyuna başladığınız andan itibaren sizde fark edersiniz. çok güzel oyun, oynayın oynattırın. ancak sıra tabanlı hiç çekemem ben diyorsanız tavsiye etmem.

it's the best game i played in all my life (i'm over 30). the story is not only deep and touching but also twisted and unforeseeable (at least some elements). the soundtrack is 11/10. i can not believe the composer was found on some obscure french forum by the ceo of sandfall. it's extremely impressively composed. in fact, i listen to it outside of the game for quite some time. graphics and animations are also very nice. unfortunately, no native fsr4 support - but nothing optiscaler can't fix. i feel very lucky to be privileged to be able to be playing this game (currently 80+ hours in). it's a one-of-a-lifetime thing i think. easily gamef the decade. i didn't even know i like jrpg turn-based, but this game opens your eyes and ruins every other game for you.

this game reminded me of the magical feeling when i first play final fantasy. it offers an experience you will only get once every 5 years or so. the art design breathe life into the world; everything looks amazing and stylish. the music fits perfectly with the scene and elevated the experience to a whole new level. even listening by themselves, they are phenomenal track. the story has the best hook in all of gaming and lots of unexpected twist and turn along the way. the story deals with serious theme but knowing when to add funny moment, there's never a tonal inconsistency throughout the gameplay. the addition of dodge and parry to the game, a simple addition, but combining with terrific boss animation, makes the combat experience very engaging and enjoyable. overall, a game you must experience in your lifetime.

very good game but not better than block tycoon and blox fruit. how do i rebirth?

very slow and dull, was a struggle to get throuhh the prolouge combat leaves a lot to be desired and theres barely anything going on in the background if you want a good turn based game the original fallouts and xcom are far better
obra maestra. no hay adjetivos para describir este juego, es perfecto. todo el mundo debería probarlo.

this was my first time playing a game with turn-based combat, and i was completely hooked. the amount of freedom is incredible—whatever you can imagine, you can actually do. between the massive variety of dialogue choices and the fact that every npc is killable, the possibilities feel endless. this game is a must-play. it is easily one of the top 3 rpgs, if not the best, i've ever played.

to be frank i didn't enjoy it as much as other people did. yes, it's very fun and deep game, yet it's just rpg that we had back in 2000. all critical acclaim comes from the fact that we don't have such games anymore.

a ce jour, la meilleur adaptation de d&d en jeu vidéo. une campagne à l'écriture impeccable, des personnages attachants et des graphismes superbes. le jeu mérite son titre de goty 2023, même si il n'est pas sans quelques **** défauts. le rythme est assez lent, rien ne se fait rapidement. la musique est parfaite et s'écoute avec plaisir, mais la caméra devient parfois horrible à gérer. la difficulté est bien équilibrée, mais certains affrontements sont un véritable cauchemar en terme de stratégie... pour ce qui est de l'équipement et des objets magiques, c'est un vrai capharnaüm. pour le reste... ce jeu est d'un richesse incroyable !

i was pretty scared to play this since it was not my type of game. but man… what a peak game. the amount of freedom this game gives you, i dont think theres another one near in terms of freedom. definitely top 3 games of decade with expedition 33 and elden ring

baldur’s gate 3 gilt für viele als das beste rollenspiel der letzten jahrzehnte – und das völlig **** spiel verbindet unglaubliche charaktertiefe, intensive entscheidungen, perfekte atmosphäre, fantastisches writing und ein taktisch brillantes kampfsystem zu einem einzigartigen erlebnis, das man sonst nirgendwo bekommt.jede entscheidung hat echte konsequenzen, jede figur wirkt lebendig, und die welt reagiert glaubwürdig auf das handeln des spielers. die freiheit, situationen kreativ zu lösen – sei es diplomatisch, chaotisch, brutal, schlau oder komplett verrückt – macht jeden durchlauf anders und **** seiner epischen story, den emotionalen momenten, großartigen begleitern und dem riesigen umfang setzt baldur’s gate 3 neue maßstäbe für rpgs.fazit: ein meisterwerk, das mehr bietet als die meisten spiele in fünf jahren zusammen. für viele das beste rollenspiel aller zeiten.
peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak peak
what can i say. this is the greatest game of our generation so far. only other games that have even come close are metaphor refantazio and expedition 33, if were talking narrative.
thank you, thank you for this game. i’m waiting for something new by larian. i’ve recently finished this game with my friend and we got a good experience

vous arrivez dans un temple ou a lieu une cérémonie précédant un enterrement. différents choix de dialogues s'ouvrent à vous :- mes condoléances. qui était ce ?- magnifique prestation des choristes, ce sont les funérailles les plus réussies auxquelles j'ai pu assister !- joli cadavre ! qu'est ce qu'on fête ?...enfin un vrai rpg avec des véritables options de dialogues et des vrais conséquences sur le long terme. votre personnage de base, votre race, votre historique, et les relations que vous avez noués avec les autres personnages de l'aventure, tout ça influe sur les options de dialogues et c'est super ! les personnages sont bien écrits et attachants, on a l'embarras du choix pour se construire son équipe, quand on a pas 3 amis avec qui jouer. il faudrait faire le jeu au moins deux fois pour en profiter, notamment pour pouvoir être un véritable méchant une fois dans sa vie, être violent sans raison et dominer le monde ! j'ai eu beaucoup de mal avec les combats au tour par tour, encore plus façon dnd. un enfer au début mais on s'y fait et ça devient un plaisir d'en maîtriser les subtilités à la fin. et putain les missclicks à 3 mm du perso et tu tapes dans le vide et tu perds ton tour, ou bien tu sautes dans un gouffre sans fond quel enfer.n'allez pas vous spoilez sur internet, vous le regretterez. et abusez du f5 (sauvegarde rapide). il y a quelques rares sauvegardes automatiques, et après chaque campement mais ca reste rare. et franchement juste le f5 pour tester les options de dialogues ca vaut le coup .
great story and character development. the only minus from me is a turn based combat which for me is really boring

non amo i giochi basati su d&d ma lo avevano proposto come prodotto adatto a tutti, anche ai non amanti del genere. non è così per niente. non mi è assolutamente piaciuto, l'ho lasciato dopo una decina di ore dove più o meno non so cosa sia accaduto e perchè.
'critical miss' the game lmao. so annoying it doesn't let you enjoy all the great stuff developers did.
its overall a very nice game with great combat, good music and a narrative driven story of revenge

çok keyifli oyun. çok düşünmeden akıcı ve keyifli bir şekilde zorluk sunan bir oyun oynamak istiyorsam dead cells'le birlikte direkt elimin gittiği oyun. farklı farklı buildler denemek ve oyunu bitirmeye çalışmak kolay kolay sıkıcılaşmıyor. karakterler de hikayeyi takip etmeseniz bile garip bir bağlanma hissi bir samimiyet oluşturuyor. her turdan sonra robot gibi hemen yeni tura geçmektense karakterlerin sana tepkilerini görmek güzel bir tazelik katıyor oyuna.
i like the style,atmosphere,combat and just i like in general man i got nothing to say its just good
game exceeds all expectations and they were very high. top tier roguelike game im super happy i played it, cant give it a 100 though because of some the cringe and gay in it otherwise its great.
im not into rogue like games, not even a little bit but this, is what a game is fun nice and a blast of a time.

i'm still having a blast. gameplay is fun and the fact that it's so well related to the story and world of hades is very good. the art is lovely. dialogs are nice, voices are even better. music fits in perfectly. very minor mistake is about some weapons not being as coherent/as well integrated as others.

increíblemente adictivo. logra que quieras desbloquear en cada run alguna mejora nueva, que genera esa sensación de progresión en un videojuego. lo jugué con hades 2 ya publicado para poder ir a su segunda entrega ya instruido. una joya

cosa succede se mischi al genere rouguelite la mitologia greca e una storia di ribellione giovanile con un art design spacca mascella e un gameplay che crea assuefazione beh vi presento hades e difficilmente vi stancherete di lui. 9.7/10
sehr gutes rougelike/lite der einzige kritikpunkt ist das es ein paar mehr waffen geben sollte, um das gameplay ein bisschen abwechslungsreicher zu gestalten.
esse jogo pra mim é perfeito em todos aspectos. divertido, desafiador, e satisfatório.
i can see why hades is so popular. i just can’t seem to get into the game. there is too much chaos and button mashing for my liking. it just feels to chaotic.

hades 2 is a very disappointing for such a highly anticipated sequel. the gameplay is still solid, but it feels too much familiar. the story moves too slowly, and the new features don’t really change much. some bosses feel frustrating rather than challenging. too bad, the first game set the bar so high.

hades ii looks great at first glance, but once you dive in, the cracks show. the combat is messy, progression feels sluggish, and the magic of the first game just isn’t there. it’s not terrible, but it’s nowhere near the masterpiece its predecessor was.

i loved the first hades, but the sequel feels like a step back. the pacing is slow, fights are unbalanced and drag on with spongey enemies, and the new characters lack the charm of the original cast. technically it’s rough too, with performance drops and clunky controls. instead of fresh ideas, it often feels like recycled content packaged as a new game.

got it gifted to me after watching two of my friends froth out the mouth over it and uhhhhh it's fine. sure, the graphics are really polished and the high speed gameplay is really engaging, but the music and voice lines are legitimately so annoying to me that i've just been playing with most of the audio muted. not to mention, some of the enemies themselves often end up turning the combat into feeling more akin to something like contra with the infuriating amount of bullets and attacks being thrown at you. most of the actual gameplay itself is fine, but there's definitely more i dislike than enjoy.

this game is one of the worst roguelikes in terms of gameplay. it's literally click-click dash. you just click on enemies from afar, and the game takes the worst aspects of combat in isometric games - the enemies are dumb, there are a lot of them, and they're so fat that you have to click on them for about 30 seconds. the gameplay is terrible, there's no depth, and there's nowhere to explore. the build system is the same - there's no variety or depth to the build - you choose one thing and focus on that for the entire run, because if you try to focus on multiple things, you won't have enough damage. it hurts me to see that many people consider this game to be one of the best roguelikes. it's not a bad game, but it's a shame for the genre as a roguelike. it's a roguelike for those who have never played a roguelike before.
no skill needed for this game, the story is boring. j’aimerais me faire rembourser si je le pouvais. j’espère qu’ils feront faillite eux ainsi que leur compagnie
o jogo é incrivel!, vale apena experimentar, unico ponto negativo é seus " bugs" e a ideia da leitura, que para mim depois de um tempo o jogo fica bem monotono e repetitivo
awesome game! been playing it since 2013! the meta reviews are outdated for 2 platforms the game isn't released on anymore... the 7 days to die - console edition is only on ps5 & xbx or xbs.

this game is the most fun i have ever played. from the start with food and water being my biggest challenge to late game when i’m pretty much a super soldier, i just cant get enough. with every block in the game able to be destroyed to build mechanics that afford you unlimited creativity. you can do anything you want. plus with the base game you have options to add mods to include overhaul mods. you literally can play this game for a lifetime. checkout glock9 on youtube and see the fun!

it was a better release than some early access games but a little disappointed to see a big v1.1 update coming out so soon after release, the update does contain some critical stuff so unfortunately it does feel like this game was out earlier than it was ready to, but unlike some other early access titles that come out of development this one was fun and pretty much bug free day one.
класная игра что бы поугарать с друзьями рекомендую

this game is one of my favorites, and i have a collective time playing it of over 700 hours and still climbing. at first glance, it seems generic, even bad to some. its graphics are still a bit rough, but even they are still improving with each update. it has an addicting gameplay loop and has a wonderful community backing it. it's a fun first person zombie survival game with base building and even some level of tower defense. it has a learning curve, but it's worth putting in the effort to get past it.

одна из лучших игр про зомби-апокалипсис. лучшая игра для время провождения как и самому, так и с друзьями. играть с друзьями в эту игру доставит вам удовольствия! если вы еще ни разу ее не играли, то быстрее идите ее покупать!!!
знаком с весны далекого 2014-го и до сих пор пристально слежу за её развитием. поднимем этот рейтинг с колен!

hallo leute ich spiele das spiel schon seit alpha 14 und was erkunden und zombie " tower defence" angeht kenne ich nichts besseres. vor allem gibt es dafür geile mods wie darkness falls oder war of the walkers natürlich auch andere..., die das spiel um einiges erweitern... geiles spiel
the best sandbox zombie game ever! try it to play, right now! i play this game since alpha 1 and the updates every year on pc are awesome!
i come back to this game again and again. wonderful atmosphere and voxel graphics will not let you get bored.

this game has been in development for more then 10 years and for the last several years those old, delusional devs made 7 days to die just worse. they didn't add any real new content, but just messed existing content, changing things and existing mechanics for no reason whatsoever. they also hate their player base with passion. the game is technical mess, graphics are bad, survival elements are mostly removed, and bright colored magic zombies killed all immersion.

the grindathon forever nature of the last few years of updates have really soured this game for me. can't scavenge water anymore. you basically have to do those radiant quests to get anything in this game, otherwise the loot tables are set so low. if i wanted to do radiant quests unending, i'd buy a subscription to fallout 76 plus.
tam sürüme çıkınca oynadım ve fak ettim ki bu oyun en az 10 yıl önce çıkmalıymış. şuan ölü doğmuş bir yapım bence.

it sure have an overall suite of working game mechanics, so you can consider this game as "playable". however these gameplay elements are not fully fleshed out and instead of polishing those systems, the devs want to rebuild each system over and over. some updates may be better than others however they forcefully remove genuinely liked parts and replace them with untested systems. they now have a roadmap to version 1.0 but we have to wait for the changes up untill then.

eu particularmente estou viciado no título, porém não posso esconder os diversos problemas que ele apresenta. acho um jogo que tem uma boa proposta de sobrevivência em um apocalipse zumbi, entregando um mundo aberto extenso, com diversos recursos e possibilidades para se explorar. mecânicas interessantes que fazem muita coerência e realismo para o game. o multijogador funciona bem, joguei sem ter problemas. sistema de paty, pvp e distribuição de recursos funcionais. torna o jogo muito mais divertido. o jogo não tem uma história para explicar aquele mundo, existem muitos bugs que podem atrapalhar a experiência do jogador, o jogo é mal otimizado, pouca variedade de designer dos zumbis comuns, os gráficos deixam a desejar em vários aspectos, uma interface pouca intuitiva para o jogador e comandos que o jogador não consegue modificar. sound effects bem duvidosos e mal distribuídos em muitos momentos. eu sou apaixonado pelo game, mas eu entendo os seus defeitos e fiz uma análise que acredito ser coerente e sincera.

por la razón que sea, esta mierda de pagina es incapaz de publicar las reseñas cuando le das al botón de enviar. y como no pienso repetir una reseña de 15 líneas lo pondré fácil: este juego es una basura absoluta, pero no tan basura como metacritic.

7 days to die suffers from significant optimization issues, making it challenging to run smoothly on anything below a mid-range gpu, typically priced around $500. this necessitates setting graphics to low for acceptable performance. the gameplay experience is marred by a cumbersome and perplexing interface. base construction, for instance, can be particularly frustrating; any mistakes require players to manually dismantle structures, a time-consuming process that hampers creativity and expansion efforts. additionally, the zombies exhibit an uncanny ability to detect the player from great distances, which can become exceedingly bothersome. in comparison, other survival games like "project zomboid" and "valheim" offer a more polished and enjoyable experience. unless you relish frustration, it might be best to look elsewhere for your survival game fix.
this game is just bad. they never finnished this game i think. even with friend its just bad. spend like 2h in and went out never go back. 2/10

good things -a magnificent literary expression -impressive music -good characters -very good psychological dialogues -a ton of political and philosophical information bad things -lgbt propaganda -unimpressive endings -very bad story -a story and characters that contain a lot of nonsense and illogicality -an overly utopian universe that will make one bored -elections don't actually have much impact

this game goes beyond merely crafting an engaging story—it breathes life into its character. rather than simply stating that someone is struggling with inner conflict, it takes the bold step of showing you exactly what’s happening inside his mind.

disco elysium is a masterpiece of video games. and a strong contender for one of the best rpgs ever made. it’s one of the few games that manages to make political commentary that is compelling, funny, and digestible to anyone reading it regardless of affiliation. all the while supplementing it with hilarious slapstick comedy and humor, as well as a thrilling whodunit murder plot. not one aspect of this game can be criticized, becides maybe one instance where you can miss some of the best end game content due to a failed dice roll
revolutionizes narrative rpgs with unmatched writing and reactive storytelling. a cerebral experience like no other.
as good as gaming gets. strange, beautiful, engaging and painful. does an amazing job of bringing you into its world.

disco elysium is more than a game disco elysium is a unique detective game where you live the life of an amnesiac alcoholic, investigate a murder and make moral choices that determine everything. the game is like a book, where every day is a new chapter, and the characters come to life thanks to their vivid characters and unforgettable dialogues. the world is filled with details: from key items and weapons to the little things that affect the development of the plot. you are given complete freedom to be whoever you want to be, make decisions and build your character. this game is suitable for those who want to feel the atmosphere of a real detective, dive into a deep story and feel responsibility for every choice.
un chef-d'oeuvre savamment écrit et un rpg culte pour les années à venir ! un système intuitif et des personnages attachant. un banger.

hardcore, hardcore to the mega! this is the closest we got to planescape: torment in decades. fantastic world building, story, art and music. it’s a click & read type game, no fluid gameplay and even years after release, there are still many technical glitches, so it’s definitely not for everyone, but if you give it a shot it will reward you with extremely unique experience and atmosphere that you won’t forget. 9/10

"the mask of humanity fall from capital. it has to take it off to kill everyone -- everything you love; all the hope and tenderness in the word. it has to take it off, just for one second. to do the deed.
very poorly written for something that involve that much text. if it was a book it would be a bad one. making it a videogame don't help it.
meh, overrated reddit tm game, just your regular modern day slop, nothing innovative and boring gameplay. smh

if reading a nihilistic "choose your own adventure" linear story (only one ending) written by self-described communists wherein you play as a godless alcoholic who has no self-control is your idea of fun... go ahead.

this is not a game. it's a text simulator filled with pseudo intellectual trash that doesn't make sense. it reads like a college freshman in a sociology class' essay. i suppose if you are into that you can play this and feel "smart". seriously. you click around and read text that's poorly written. that's it.

first of all, it's not an rpg. second, it's not a good game as a quest either. there are no interesting characters or plot. literally none of the choices are thought-provoking. the only good thing about this game is its interesting original visual style. but even it's basically just a recolor from a bunch of other similar quests

oh i love rpgs with a lot of text! - i thought and sat down to play this game. what a disappointment. lots of text, zero meaning. brain gum for pseudo-intellectuals. moreover, this is not an rpg. this is one long drawn out quest. like one from skyrim where you have to track down a maniac in windhelm, you know =) and there is absolutely no rpg component here. you can't create a character. and even the characteristics don’t affect anything (otherwise why are the “stupid” character’s lines not different from the other 2 branches? you can’t choose normal options in dialogues, because they simply don’t exist, and those that exist don’t affect anything (try not to wake up in the first dialogue, for example). but there will be a bunch of texts about what to do with material things. what is this, a text sims??? the characters are worthless, there is literally no empathy for anyone, because they are just only cardboards - decorations for the riots and tomfoolery of the main character. by the way, the humor here is also bad. the level of marginal drunks. the setting is certainly unusual, but damn, even in the wolf among us there are more plot rpg elements. the only thing i can praise disco for is that it’s interesting an original avant-garde visual. this is where its merits end
the game is incredibly fun, well worth the price, and offers some surprising gameplay toward the end. it’s definitely worth completing to experience the true ending

ولم أكمل اللعبة والانطباع من لعب حوالي 15 ساعة وفيهذه المدة تتضح لك أساسيات اللعب فرغم أن البداية بطيئة لكن عند دخول اللعب ترى الاختلاف في نظام اللعب برجوع المانا ونظام الضرب والصد واختلاف المهارات في التوقيت الحكم على القصة صعب بدون اكمالها لكن العلاقة بين الشخصيات جيدة هذه أهم الامور والله ولي التوفيق
