is a 8 **** itself but the postlaunch care put it in a solid nine. the dedevelopers have studied and refresh old school ideas to keep their game nostalgic but fresh. the combat never gets old and the world feels like a platformer somehow. is also a lesson of pixel art

superbe petit jeu, graphisme old school, systéme de combat au tour par tour dynamique avec des parades, des attaques a améliorer via la pression du bouton action au bon moment, ce qui rend les affrontements vraiment interressant. l'exploration est assez sympathique, beaucoup de petites enigmes, puzzles a résoudre pour trouver des coffres secrets ou juste avancer dans l'histoire, excellente surprise que ce rpg old school.

o sabotage studio, como em "the messenger", conseguiu criar uma história cativante, cheia de reviravoltas, personagens carismáticos e uma trilha sonora absurda de boa. só não dou 10/10 por conta do combate ser um pouco simples em algumas situações. de resto, jogo incrível.
exactly what i have been searching for as a follow up to chrono trigger from my younger days. great story, art, and especially the music.

game could have certainly been higher. i think the combat is fun, music slaps, and the story surprisingly interesting (at times). however, the dialogue is often too long, and the game takes a little bit to show its true colors. the first third of the game is pretty boring before you unlock more characters, more abilities etc. and the story begins to take shape. still a good game

am a big fan of jrpg games, but this game is not in the same league of square enix or atlus classic rpgs. don't expect chrono trigger or ff6 quality, as this game suffers from very simplistic and overly shallow writing. story telling is quite weak as this is the developer's first rpg game. combat is decent and does keep me interested. ending is not really satisfying, which bums me after spending 40 hours playing the game. the "real" ending is locked behind some frustrating requirement, so most players wont get to see it. overall, a decent game but not very polished and overated by community.

a true gem. took the best from jrpg. every aspect of the game is perfectly made by this small studio, bravo! although, for me personally, the story itself (which is actually rich) and the narrative are rather messy and don't close up very well. and the game doesn't encourage you to use the camp mechanic very much, hard to say if that's a bad thing. but overall, the game is still great. i look forward to seeing more in this genre from the creators!

the story in this game is so bad, and the worst part is the whole game is making you sit through the constant filler content to beef up your artificial playtime. they really hired someone incompetent to write the story for them. there isn't enough actual gameplay as most of it is spamming next to skip the **** story. the movement was pretty cool, and some of the art, but the same cant be said about the pixel characters. they needed a bit of work and they often looked nothing like their image / animated scenes. like the girl protag having a burnt scar on her forehead in her pixel version which is supposed to be just a poorly done shadow

i really, really, really wanted to love this game, but i can’t. in the beginning, it seems to do everything right: the characters seem good, the plot is interesting, the world feels alive, and the fights are engaging. but most of that fades way too fast. while the story stays compelling for a while, the first cracks in the characters appear pretty soon. and even though you can forgive some blunders, they accumulate, and by the time you get to the middle of the story, they are all but falling apart. that is also the point where i noticed that i don’t care for the story anymore. it wasn’t that great before, but it became bad afterwards.sadly, even the fights are way too monotonous, with each character having basically the same moves throughout the game. i never finished it, but i watched videos (in hopes of rekindling the flame), and apparently, it gets even more unravelled later on.

it's a trap! nice graphics but... horrible story. flat and surreal characters. absurd mechanics, you can't escape from the fight in progress, you can't teleport at will (unlocking points of interest) but only in a few cases after an exhausting useless backtracking. avoid if you are looking for something more by pressing random buttons while looking at beautiful backgrounds don't fall for this.. this is the definition of rose tinted glassess nostalgia bait.

this game is vapid nostalgia bait. please dont listen to the critics who just have nostalgiia for the pixel art jrpg past that was replaced by better systems. they yearn for simpler times when they were 15 years old. those times aren't coming back. i'm tired of these people being unable to look at things objectively and propping up retrogressive crap like this. i was so bored that i couldn't finish this cutesy snoorefest.

the graphics? gorgeous. the tunes? absolute bangers. it’s like they’re screaming, “this is gonna be epic!” but man, once i got into it, it was like expecting a gourmet meal and getting fast food instead. the characters? they’re kinda there, but not really making me feel anything. they’re supposed to shape the world, but everything just felt… meh. and the fights, they started out cool, but didn’t go anywhere. it’s like playing the same level over and over. plus, there’s this one character who keeps breaking the fourth wall, pointing out all the clichés. just let me get lost in the game! i really wanted to get into sea of stars, rooting for it to be my new obsession. but it’s like it’s stuck in the shadow of the old-school legends, trying too hard to be like them without bringing anything new to the table. it’s a feast for the eyes, sure, but it doesn’t hit you in the feels like the classics do.
just like ready player one the movie. it's beautiful and full of nostalgia and that's it. the gameplay is boring after 5 hours and the story have been written by a 6 years old..

precioso juego que trata de la pérdida de un ser querido y la superación del duelo. es un juego relajante, reflexivo, un poco misterioso y melancólico, con ciertos puntos de humor muy dulces que te harán sonreír en mas de una ocasión. los personajes tienen cierta profundidad y es imposible no sentirte identificado y empatizar con alguno de **** nota que los desarrolladores han puesto mucho cariño al diseñarlo.
this game will forever stay in my heart. the stories, art, music, everything was on point. this is one of those games you will always remember with a warm heart.

this is a very relaxing game! no pressure to do the quests. lots of exploration. you're contributing to someone's wellness so has a good heartwarming feel. lots of new things to do as you slowly keep unlocking more and more. the only cons were one of the main characters (the deer) is extremely self-absorbed and narcissitic. and all dialogues are extremely verbose and boring. who talks like that in real life? besides these 2 things it's pretty awesome. there's a variety of gameplay like cutting trees, smelting, cooking exploration, island exploration, navigating to new places on the map etc. i played it for 7-8% and i'm saving it for my retirement. this would be a good one to play in the future.

i love this game i can't describe how much i love this game the characters and everything else i absolutly love it my favorite game of all time and my favorite character is and stay forever like this daria
all i can say about spiritfarer is this is a made with love down to the tiniest details

spiritfarer is a beautifully crafted gem that offers a unique blend of soothing gameplay and heartfelt storytelling. the game's cozy atmosphere is unmatched, making it a perfect escape to unwind. improving your ship adds a satisfying layer of customization and creativity, while exploring its vibrant, hand-drawn world is endlessly engaging. with its gentle rhythms and emotional depth, "spiritfarer" feels like a warm hug **** yet brimming with adventure. whether you're connecting with its memorable characters or simply enjoying the journey, it's a delightful experience worth savoring.

the game is beautifull , relaxing , have a great community , he is easy to play no need to be skilled , you will not have to defeat some eldrish abominations. try it , the game will make you cry with his delightfull story. the other games of the studio are really cool too try it. in resume very good story , gameplay and graphic and attentive dévelopers

i started this game thinking, 'what even is this?' and ended it feeling like it had etched itself into my very bones. every spirit i bid farewell to made me reflect on my own life. it makes you feel something—something deep, melancholic, yet strangely comforting. spiritfarer isn’t just a game; it’s an experience, a beautifully crafted meditation on loss, love, and letting go. the hand-drawn visuals are breathtaking, the soundtrack lingers in your soul, and the balance between management mechanics and heartfelt storytelling is masterful. even in its quietest moments, the game never feels dull; instead, it invites you to embrace the journey, one farewell at a time.

não é apenas um jogo, é uma experiência. um novo conceito de como contar uma boa história. se você se permitir mergulhar na magia do jogo, tenho certeza de que irá se encantar. a gameplay pode ser um obstáculo para alguns, já que é simples, sem grandes desafios ou dificuldade. no entanto, todo o encanto do jogo está em sua proposta: uma narrativa cativante, uma ambientação repleta de carisma e personalidade, com um estilo visual único e músicas incríveis. cada nova descoberta ao longo da campanha é um verdadeiro deleite.

beautiful graphics and art style. beautiful music. beautiful and profound game that teach us about life and death. i cried so many times while playing this game. it really touched me. charming characters and amazing story that you unfold during your playtime. a very cozy game in general.

game just goes on and on. the pacing is terrible and it just feels like a waste of time and made me quit before i finished the game. everything is so sluggish, i really do not like these wholesome type games. especially if it wastes my time like this game tries to do.

i pity the fools who like this game. lazy writing, it throws ideas at the player without properly develop them. i had very high expectations thanks to the tons of overrated reviews, the game has a cute art style but is very buggy and it may appeal people who never has been engaged with a proper dramatic script. i wish i could get my money and time back. sorry for the incendiary title, i'm just extremely disappointed to see everyone going crazy for this.

there is no reason why a game that sold over 1 million copies should still have such a broken menu interface. you also can't do borderless fullscreen, and the pause in background toggle not only does not work via the normal controls, but it also does nothing when you switch it on and off. this effectively makes the game impossible to stream. this game is still selling a lot of copies, and the lack of care or follow through is extremely disappointing. there is absolutely no way im going to invest dozens of hours of my time playing something made by a team that refuses to even get it's menu or user interface to work properly.
this game changed my life. it gave me a new perspective on death, and it pretty much got me through covid. so yeah, if you like games like **** valley,i 100% would try this game
should be a good game if the price went below $2. i won't pay one extra cent for this
i started playing the game on android. sadly there is bug which does not allow continue the game. i've reported bug to the netflix (which is responsible for android version) and feel ignored.

insanely fun and enjoyable game with a high complexity level, but in a good way. there are various playstyles in this game and you can choose how you want to play it and how much you immerse yourself in it. still being updated a lot, and the sound tracks can be amazing.

очень приятная, интересная и забавная стратегия. из минусов конечно это технические проблемы, которые, не буду лукавить, появляются не редко. ну и то, что парадоксы обленились и в последнее время выпускают халтуру за большие цены. ну, а так если вам что-то придет в голову, то знайте, тут оно уже есть и его можно реализовать))) ставлю не 10, ибо мы хотим длс про славян и русь!!! нахрен нам какой-то китай и япония, если можно сделать гигантский пак длс про славян, которое понравится огромной части игроков!?

gameplay is great. i enjoy it very much. one of few games from paradox that have quite good tutorial after which you can go straight to the game without need to watch countless videos on youtube just to understand basic mechanic of the game. one of the best if not the best game from paradox.
is it a flawed game? yes. is it enjoyable to play? also yes. while there are some bugs and the dlcs are expensive, and some mechanics are underdeveloped, i like the game. its fun.

probablement le meilleur simulateur d'affaires extra-conjugales disponible pour nos petites pupilles, ck3 est un jeu au gameplay assez profond pour offrir un grand nombre de possibilités à ses joueurs sans pour autant tomber dans l'absurde complexité d'autres jeux paradox (oui, je pense très fort à hearts of iron 4). les seuls points négatifs sont la musique plutôt plate à mon goût mais surtout les problèmes de desync pendant les parties multijoueur.

crusader kings iii, benim için büyük bir merakla başladığım ama sonunda hayal kırıklığı yaşadığım bir oyun oldu. i̇lk 10 saat boyunca gerçekten keyifli bir deneyim sunuyor, ancak sonrasında her şey tekrara biniyor. farklı ülkelerle oynamak, sadece aynı şeyleri daha güçlü ya da daha zayıf bir devletle yapmak gibi hissettiriyor. bu da birkaç farklı ülkeyle oynadıktan sonra oyunu sıkıcı hale getiriyor. i̇leride nasıl olur bilemem ama şu anki haliyle içerik açısından oldukça eksik.

gran juego de estrategia, para mi gusto uno de los mejores actualmente, muy completo con una gran cantidad de mecánicas por explorar, la única queja que se puede sacar de este juego es que sigue la ética habitual de paradox interactive de partir el juego para despues sacarlo en dlcs, aun así considero que la experiencia vanilla del juego sin dlcs es en gran medida disfrutable y con los mods de la store de steam la experiencia es incluso mejor, recomendable en gran medida.

an excellent game that shines again and again with every new update. this is a role-play simulation game so you should roleplay a lot if you want to enjoy it to the fullest. the game gives you the entrée. rest is on your imagination and creativity. if you enjoy this kind of gameplay, you will fall in love with this game.
excellent strategy game from start to finish. super immersive and addictive love this game
ck3 is a very bad 'game', the graphics is as bad as in mobile games. i'm sorry that i gave money for this game,
the game is broken beyond repair with bugs more than f76 on launch. oh, and the newest update with eastern roman empire made them so broken it is impossible to play in europe now.
the story is unclear, where does russian come from, where is this word from the 860s. perverted nations.

it feels like the devs don't understand what makes ck2 a great sandbox roleplay game. the events are repetitive, most civs play the same, the balance is absolutely broken (in particular, the way the activities' costs scale is one of the dumbest idea i've seen in a video game and makes any attempt at roleplaying a doom to your whole economy), no strategy in war: enemy ai armies are just lost and confused, just like paradox' devs. so, rpg elements are repetitive and overall way inferiors to ck2, most game mechanics are either broken or just unfun, 5 years and 150€ of dlc for this result...
got bored after 10 hours of playing it i guess my adhd is just too big to play this game

can't recommend in this state at this price. * too much focus on rpg part of the game (frequent random events that get repetitive/annoying very quickly) instead of the mechanics. many parts of the game could use new/deeper mechanics (hre, papacy, crusades, diplomacy, republics etc.). unfortunately the dlc seems to focus on even more rpg events instead of core game mechanics. * game too easy overall. limitless aggressive expansion is possible. intrigue is too powerful. * bad ui, even by paradox standards. the new map lacks many important viewmodes that were essential in ck2, and requires you to zoom in/out constantly to finally fade in the content you need (armies, counties etc. - but at the same time you get useless terrain features, snow effects etc.). this requires constant use of the mouse wheel, which makes for very poor ergonomics. ui scaling beyond 130 % not possible without losing content, making text too small on uhd displays.

first half top, second half flop. the first half of the game was super interesting, fun and exciting, although often not easy to figure out what to do. from about halfway through, however, this gets out of hand. you have no plan where to go, what to do, or why to do anything. the puzzles, which are logical and fun at the beginning, become too frequent and illogical over time, making them frustrating. the game relies too much on its scripted events. if you haven't done a exactly as planned, you'll find yourself standing in front of closed doors at b. it gives you a false sense of freedom of choice and is actually very hard railroading. a lot of potential was wasted and i hope the second part is better.
it seems fine but clearly not meant to be played solo. gets boring fairly quickly.

the opening was quite difficult which is an issue. the ending dragged **** the middle was incredible, i couldn't put it down. i think it was awesome that most of the sidequests were the same quality (approximately) as the main story, some sidequests i couldn't even tell were sidequests, and in a market where we barely even get a finished game released, to say nothing about quality of story or sidequests, this was nice. i picked this up with divinity; original sin 2 to decide if i would like to buy baldur's gate 3, i wanted to see if the dnd type of gameplay would interest me, and it did. i think i might pick up baldur's gate 3 in a little while. we will see if i play through the sequel first.
was an amazing game for it's time, paved the way to make it's even better sequel dos: ii. larian hitting it out of the ballpark as usual.

after playing the game for the first time, i played as if i was possessed by something for two hours i ended up with 140 hours of play time and watching the ending it was my first time doing this genre and it was shocking
very nice rpg very nice game if i need to compare among all other games by the way.
my favourite rpg so far, i like everything in it, it's just perfect. if you're a fan of great old school "smart" and very funny rpg, it's a mustplay!!
one of my favorite split screen games! i wish they would make "original sin iii".

divinity: original sin( i will call it just dos) is first from the wave of "modern crpgs". and it was quite revolutionary for it's time, i must say. is brings interesting story, quest and characters. as rpg it is very good: you can be an altruistic hero or a veeery bad guy. the main disadvantage of the is, as for me, it's tactics. the thing is that it is based on random stunning effect, and you easily complete the game if you are lucky( or ruin if you are unlucky). the second disadvantage is that it becomes quite boring in the end. i thing it is mainly caused by tactics system. so, i think that dos is a good game, and deserves 8/10. i can recommend this game to anybody, wgo likes rpgs, crpgs or love good games.
playing this game is like pulling teeth in the dark. this has got to be one of the worst games i have ever played in my entire life

wow this is trash. first off the story is boring and lack of interest. gameplay is fun but not balanced at all. maps are not cool and the game is poorly level designed. the second one is a masterpiece compared to this
god does not play dice
game is pure overhyped garbage: dull quests super slow unfair turn-based combat map traverse is slow and tedious ui - makes you literally hurt

the absolute worst. good luck going through the damn door to finsh the game. after 50 years if you somehow manage to kill everthing in the game, searching every corner for those stupid stone, and find the last stone buried in a **** random place to be able to go through the door, there's a **** bookshelf blocking your way. great. you stiuck. you have to solve more stupuid puzzles but where puzzles. this is the pinnacle of **** game design

вся игра это какое то одно большое превозмогание. боевка просто отвратительная, меня постоянно не покидало чувство, что я играю отрядом инвалидов, которые имеют много умений, но они нихуя не юзабельны. система сохранений - сохраняет когда ей вздумается. баланс классов просто отсутствует - вор и лучник бесполезны чуть больше чем полностью. ахуеть, вместо того, что бы получать радость от игры у меня постоянно было чувство страдания. походу целью разработчиков была проверка игроков на прочность. система таргетинга откровенно хуевая - время от времени то и дело, что получаются миссклики. вместо того что бы ударить - персонаж начинает пиздовать кудато, что невыносимо выводит из себя. враги постоянно имеют преимущество над персонажами. взять для примера вражеских лучников - они стреляют чаще и точнее чем персонаж лучник. я хз за что игре выставили такие большие оценки. юмор присудствует это правда, сюжет вроде как не плохой, графика сойдет. но геймплей это пиздец. контактниками играть невозможно, постоянно поджоги, подскальзывания, отравление, хоть бери да просто круги нарезай вокруг врагов, ожидая того как маг и лучник через 9000 ходов одолеют врагов. после того как я проиграл один из боев и попытался загрузится, оказалось, что последнее автосохранение было хер знает когда и совсем в другой локации. я просто не выдержал, нажал alt+f4 и удалил игру к хуям от греха подальше.
boring combat, old mechanics, ugly graphic and terrible story and lore... once again cash grab from glitchstarter end up as failure... go buy something thats actually a game not dead-genre corpse

it's a pretty game, with fun story. the only reason in the end, i found it's good, is that it's voice acted. the ai is broken, making the game easy. the loot system almost seems discouraging and tedious. the lewd mini stories are also questionable. overall i have it a 4, due to the ai breaking and lewdness. if you can look past, a tedious loot system, a broken ai in the late game and the sexual lewdness then, you maybe think better of it that i.

larian studios bien connu pour ses jeux de rôle bâclés nous sort son petit épisode indé aux graphismes à la casimir, couleurs criardes, direction artistique sans direction. le machin fait chauffer la carte graphique comme s'il s'agissait de crysis 3 alors qu'on ne compte guère plus de 256 couleurs à l'écran.... où va le monde. le moteur 3d foireux limite même l'angle de vue sous peine d'artefacts graphiques quand on force l'option : pour un jeu en vue aérienne, ça fait tache. l'univers générique s'avère des plus niais et seules des voix anglaises sont disponibles. le système de combat en tour par tour n'est pas mal mais là aussi la niaiserie s'invite dans tous les coins : on dirait un jeu nintendo. franchement les gars de chez larian, vous n'avez ni les moyens, ni les ambitions nécessaires pour vous atteler à un genre aussi exigeant que le jeu de rôle et encore moins de talent. de grâce, cantonnez-vous à des **** jeux casuals pour smartphones et tablettes, c'est plus de votre niveau.

terribly overrated game. let me tell you something kids, as a hardcore rpg veteran with decades of experience: just because you are starved for a new rpg, doesn't mean that every piece of garbage that arrives at the stores and has character stats is worth it. back in the day, we experienced a similar rpg drought, which ended with fallout, baldur's gate, diablo, and final fantasy vii. see? we celebrated with real classics, not this overrated garbage. this game is huge, but only because it is tedius. you will go pixel hunting like a mad man for no reason. it is filled with containers that have nothing inside. it has plenty of mechanics and stats to master but once you finally understand the system it lacks serious depth. the turn based combat is slow, boring, and has no reason to be turn based. the story is meh. the dialogs are cringe-worthy. decent graphics and voice acting, and after patches is at a very good shape, but this is not enough. it will demand a lot of time and patience from you, but it won't satisfy you. it doesn't really deliver as an rpg. those who compare this to the classics like baldur's gate, are out of their minds and i am fairly certain they have never played it. i suppose if you like co-op with a friend, it could be worth it. as a single player experience, just replay bg again. deserves around a 6, giving it a 1 to counterbalance the overinflated scores.

this game is more like an adventure game with illogical puzzles and quests. i could not progress anything without a walkthrough, then it becomes a tedious errand running exercise. and when you leave the starting town, it is either empty or full of higher level enemies who kill you quickly. space is way too slow. levelling up is weird, the game will not let you increase certain stats to 2. sank in 6-8 hrs and apart from a few errand quests, could not do anything. if you like slow paced rpgs and adventure games, you may like this, otherwise stay away.

oyunun açık dünyası güzel büyülerle kombo yapmak eğlenceli ama yan görevler vasat sadece karakter geliştirmek için yapılır sonra affedlimez lanetleri açın oyun katlanabilir oluyor sebastian dışındaki karakterler çöp ana hikayede idare eder

never watched nor read harry potter before, so i went into this game completely blind and not sure what to really expect. the game did a good job at teaching what different things were and what certain things meant, even if it wasn't important to gameplay, which helped me understand the world a bit more. the fighting felt fluid and amazing, the character customization was nice, the story was fun, the graphics were beautiful, this game was just amazing through and through.

o trabalho envolvido no desenvolvimentodo jogo é realizado com muito carinho, por fãns da franquia mesmo pois o jogo é muito bem detalhado com referências e designs únicos, verdadeiras obras de arte. graficamento fora de hogwarts o mundo é bem modelado e distribuido mas um pouco vazio, ainda que você trombe com 1 grupo de vira latas ou uma pessoa caminhando na estrada a maior parte do tempo vai ser você e os pensamentos do seu personagem durante a viagem. jogabilidade é muito divertida, a escolha de parry com combos das magias somadas a fluidez do combat e das animações são sensacionais, muito divertido, elegante e satisfatório. mesmo com bastante combos interativos com determinados inimigos o jogo sofre ainda de baixa variedade de inimigos e de tempo de vida pós missão principal, se tal decisão foi para promover a performance do game, ainda sim não resultou em boas performances no pc, o jogo mesmo com uma maquina potente ainda sofre para renderizar alguns ambientes principalmente voando em altas temperaturas.

wizardly freedom. finally getting an open world harry potter game. wish it was mmorpg but this game was pretty great. having mounts and numerous spells. wish the story had more grit but had a great time playing.

un juegazo! yo ya era medio fan de hp, pero este juego mehizo super fan, me vi todas las peliculas de nuevo despues de jugarlo. de verdad que no tiene desperdicio, lo unico malo es que es corto, en comparacion a otros juegos y que la historia no es tan buena. pero en todo lo demas 10/10

hogwarts legacy is a dream come true for fans of the wizarding world, offering an immersive journey into the halls of hogwarts and beyond. the game beautifully captures the magic and wonder of the harry potter universe, with stunning visuals, an expansive open world, and gameplay that makes you feel like you're truly living in that world. from casting spells to exploring hidden secrets, every moment is filled with nostalgia and **** gameplay is a highlight, providing a mix of exploration, combat, and puzzle-solving that keeps you engaged throughout your adventure. the world of hogwarts legacy is nothing short of amazing, with every corner of the castle and surrounding areas meticulously crafted to create an authentic experience.however, the game isn't without its flaws. one of the noticeable drawbacks is the boss battles. while the encounters are visually impressive, the bosses lack a certain aura of intimidation and challenge that you’d expect. they often feel underwhelming, which detracts from the overall excitement of these key moments.additionally, while the game’s world is rich and detailed, the lore and story can feel a bit flat at times. some aspects of the narrative don’t quite

this game is good, but it felt like we were at hogwarts for a walk, not to be students. my overall rating is that the game is good, but it's not a masterpiece. story: 5/10 this game's story is average. i didn't play it for the story. being a harry potter fan, i was able to endure the story. combat: 8/10 the combat is very good, but the difficulty in switching between spell sets and the limited number of spells are annoying. characters: 5/10 almost all the characters in the game are very boring. including our main character. the only character i really liked was sebastian sallow. the dialogue from all the characters is very boring. quests: 7/10 except for some quests, the quests are poor and unimpressive, but they're still quite good. if you're a harry potter fan, you won't be bored. gameplay: 8/10 the gameplay is good. simple. the switching between spell sets is annoying. flying in the game is fine, but it would be nice if there were more things to do while flying. graphics: 8.5/10 the game's graphics are quite nice. the landscapes look great, but they're not 10/10. the side activities in the game are quite nice. my overall rating for the game is 8/10.

متعة ممتازة في تجسيد العالم ونقله من الرواية للعبة بعالم متفاعل بالحوارت بينك وبين الشخصيات أو بين الشخصيات نفسها مهام جميلة متنوعة ومهمات جانبية مهمة للشخصيات الفرعية لانها تحكي قصصهم أسلوب لعب رائع وتعويذات مهمة في اللعب تتناسب كل تعويذة مع عدو معين وفي حالات معينة قصة جميلة ليست قوية وليست سخيفة وضعيفة وقوتها في كونها تحكي قصتك الخاصة

as someone who isn't the biggest wizarding world fan but still bought the $70 deluxe edition i would give the game a 7.1. its been about 1-2 years since i last played, but this is my review from what main take aways i remember from playing during the first month after release. it had some features that were cool to have and others that just fell flat. i think the attention to detail with the world was really cool as it felt you were truly in the movies. i think the story was also really good and engaging. it also was a nice touch with how your decisions can change your ending. my biggest regret was buying the deluxe edition as i mainly bought it for the thestral mount but by the time you finally unlock mounts you will already have your broomstick lvl 2 or 3 and it will be faster to use and easier to control. i also liked how we got our own customizable rooms to use but after unlocking it and customizing the room after the tutorial i never went back besides when new sections got added. the combat is ok as i like that it forces you to use a mixture of the spells but the switching between spells during combat was not the smoothest and required you to remember the layout of what you had to quickly/smoothly transition to them but is kind of hard as you are adding spells pretty regularly.

talvez hogwarts legacy não fosse o jogo esperado pelos maiores fãs do universo de harry potter, mas nisso nao significa que seja um jogo ruim. o mundo de hogwarts é (sem trocadilhos intencionais) mágico, e essa é definitivamente amelhor versão de hogwarts já vista nos jogos. explorar esse universo por si só ja é uma experiencia incrivel, complementada por uma historia que apesar de simples, conta com bons personagens. um dos maiores destaques da história no entanto está em uma quest opcional, o que pode fazer com que alguns jogadores percam essa excelente experiência.

me just entering hogwarts: killed a lot of people already. the gameplay feels repetitive, side quests are basiclly killing and killing and finding hidden stuff. the story is full of rubbish, cannot relate a single bit.

start of game was rough with performance but it was fun. the game gets pretty empty after a while but otherwise mods helped solve both problem along with nice updates. until publisher decided to make their own mod browser and 2 account system for it along with monopolization for future. right not they are free but im 100% sure they will be paid later on. they also broke all the mods from previous update and it include breaking performance with new update going from 200 fps to 60? this is really a joke. i am really, really glad that its only game i bought from them, it seems like they treat their own community as joke and milking cows. i will also edit it if they fix those problems as for now its solid 1 but gamestory i still enjoyed so its bonus 1 point.

optimization **** ass but game isnt that bad..musics are good sometımes and ıt has good animations but dialogs are so cringe and forced and pointless... ooo here you are, yes i am here, i glad you are here, its nice to see you come back ,i hope you came more often, ....god damn i just came move on

great aesthetics and nostalgic feeling for hp fans. period. the rest is empty, vast and hollow. the lore is shallow, the characters flat, the gameplay is downright terrible. i had to remove any item from me just to have a slight challengebutcould still oneshot bosses. it is just an exploration experience in the hogwarts world, which is beautifully painted. negative extra: they purposefully removed quidditch to sell it separately.. be better

the world is so empty and shallow, makes the ubisoft games look great lol,story doesnt make sense at all, no need to mention so many ethnicities in game which in reality harry potter universe doesn't have any ethnicity other than white british, what a shame.

i expected way more from this game. it has incredibly bad and boring storyline from fairytales, and characters are the flattest of all games. only real good thing on this game is the map and castle , both is beautiful. but except that it is just money maker on well known brand for money. i expected huge rpg with awesome story and got boring game that feels almost empty.

it's not a aaa game, it's an aa game. i was happy to play an hp game after so many years, but i was disappointed. the game is an empty game made to make money. i said very nice things to those who caused this game to be so bad from the bottom to the top, you get it :)
quite beautiful, but empty game. it is lifeless. so much of a potential is lost.
amazing visuals, interesting characters with great story lines, excellent combat mechanics. a must play for lovers of jrpgs
a masterpiece. imagine a game with such minimalistic graphics hits harder than most aaa games nowadays.

เป็นเกมที่เล่นได้เพลินๆ ไม่มากไม่น้อยไปกว่านั้น เกมเพลย์ก็ rpg turnbase ทั่วๆไป มีเพิ่มเติมระบบนู่นนี่นิดหน่อย กราฟฟิคค่อนข้างสวย มีเอกลักษณ์ ส่วนเนื้อเรื่องค่อนข้างจะดาษดื่น มีหลายจุดที่รู้สึกว่าช้าเกินไป แต่ก็เร่งไม่ได้ ทำให้หงุดหงิดค่อนข้างบ่อย

octopath traveler is less of an rpg and more like eight mini rpgs rolled into one. the diverse character cast allows for widely different stories and a vastly different experience. it is wildly unlike anything i could have ever hoped to expect, and it would be better if there were more games like it. it is an absolute masterpiece that everyone should play.

a beautiful game, great soundtrack and an interesting story. the best thing about this game is the secret/true ending where all 8 stories are combined and the characters share an ending. the difficulty of the game is enough to challenge you, especially because of the final boss, and you will need to understand each class/profession. finally, we recommend that you complete all the secondary stories, to unlock the true ending and prepare for the last boss. a game that when you complete it 100% (all the stories and the true ending) you will love.
one of the best games i have played. even played it a second time to get the true ending
good game, got that metal slug art style, very good story but can't really connect them to each other except when using the travel banter, also very grindy and expensive, but definitely a good game

the game i've had the most fun with in the past few years, i think. beautiful environments and music, had fun with battles and strategizing for them i recommend english monolingual people play with japanese voice acting and english text settings in general visuals: 8/10 audibles: 8/10 interaction: 7/10

unos pixeles hermosos, unos cuantos principales olvidables, y unas ciudades y locaciones bastante interesantes, son algunas de las cosas que componen este juego, aunque tambien lo conforman una subida de nivel con grindeo, ciudades vacias y misiones secundarias realmente repetitivas. realmente no es que esperes mas de un juego de este estilo, pero la sensacion que te da el estar jugando despues de unas 30 horas de juego (30 horas en las que aun no termino la historia principal del personaje principal debido a que necesito subir de nivel) es de cansancio, nada te apega a seguir la historia de los demas companeros que no te interesan, es un juego realmente entretenido al inicio de partida con batallas deasafiantes, pero nada te detiene a desinstalarlo despues de saber lo que te ofrece este juego.
overpriced and underdeveloped generic jrpg. i would give it 5/10 if it was under 8 dollars.

bu oyunun görseli güzel. 16 bit görüntü ve unreal engine 4 ikilisi güzel ama, oyun bok gibi. hikaye desen yok, aksiyon, macera vb. yok. ve oyun 60 küsür dolar. şimdi bu oyun indi bir oyun mu yoksa triplay oyun mu belli değil. o yüzden oyuna 10 üzerinden puanım 2 veya 3. görsel güzel ama enfes donemindeki animasyonlar gibi yapmanıza gerek yok.

is this a joke? i don't understand how we can have such a poor designed game in this day an age, you might as well get a snes emulator and play any of the games in that platform. the storylines are plain out generic, made a million times over, the fight system has very little going on for itself. the game is a massive grind, you get generic story after generic story, i'm guessing you're supposed to collect all 8 travelers but after collecting 2 or 3 of them you realise you're in a silly grinding loop filled up with generic content, generic monsters which don't pose any challenge after a short while, and i didn't finish it, but i'm going to guess the completion of each story must be more of the generic content you have. wrapped up in graphics from 20 years ago, you've got yourself a huge scam of a videogame, and somehow the internet is piled up with positive reviews, i've got no idea what on earth they're doing, maybe it's very young people who haven't seen this a million times? i don't know, if you managed to play this for more than a few hours i commend you on your stubbornness, it has worst graphics, worse gameplay and worse story than an average money grabbing gacha mobile game.

i stopped playing this game because it's graphics are so primitive. the look of the game is so primitive it's not even cute or nostalgic. developers, maybe there's a fine game in there, but please provide games with modern graphics, and, especially, drop that strong depth of field blur.

pro's amazing artstyle that pays homage to classic jrpgs 8 characters each with their own story and playstyle good voice overs, nice music cons inexcusably tedious combat boring lacking polish octopath traveler would have been great on snes or ps1 back in the late 90s but for this era it is very dated which is a shame because graphically, it has a lot of vintage charm with nice graphics and some interesting story telling that unfortunately is let down by obnoxiously slow paced combat that makes the game get exceptionally boring fast forcing the player to either not bother and move on to a faster paced game, even by all classic snes jrpgs virtually none have the same tedious turn based combat style. square enix, you know better! don't ever make a turn based jrpg that takes several minutes just to beat one basic monster this makes for a tedious eye rolling slog. it doesn't matter how deep the combat system is if you have players bored in the first hour of playing.
bad story = bad jrpg. octopath traveller is a bad jrpg very overpriced music is good combat is ok (for turn based system)

this is an old fashioned j-rpg game with lengthiness dialogue and turn-based fight that would cost the player massive time. the interest in the plots is faded in such a long and boring time. btw, xbox controller is not supported in this game, and keyboard input **** too. i recommended you not to spend your time and money on octopath traveller. if you really a j-rpg lover and want to try this game, i suggest you buy the ns edition that controller is supported and you can sell the game card after finishing it.
парни, единственный русский обзор игра - не стоит своих денег ни разу, не берите, особенно в стим за 4500

some nice storiew here and there but some others average too. art and design, combat and music are excellent and it improves from the first one but, the high random encounter rate, and the lack of depth it gets repetitive after a few hours, especially once you unlock everyone skills.

better than the first in every way it quickly became one of my favorite game of all times. the gameplay, the visual and the soundtrack are amazing. the story is quite cliché but it's still enjoyable and the jp voice acting is really great.

the beautiful artwork in irreplaceable hd-2d graphics and the combat experience that brings each character's personality to the turn-based battles is a great experience for fans of the past. the story of each hero is also more immersive than before, and the game is a masterpiece that improves on the mechanics and details that were lacking in its predecessor.

de alguna forma se las ingeniaron para hacer algo aún mejor de lo que fue la primera entrega, excelente tanto en el apartado artístico, incluyendo la historia, como en la jugabilidad, se superaron a si mismos lo único en lo que peca es que, al igual que en la primera entrega, no presenta un desafío real en ningún momento. no hubo un solo combate en que un boss me pusiera contra las cuerdas (o que siquiera requiriese esfuerzo), incluso debía desequiparme continuamente las habilidades del tipo "más experiencia" para no sobrelevelearme accidentalmente, aunque todo el resto de la experiencia de juego es tan gratificante que se lo perdono, el único motivo para no dar un 10/10 es la falta de un modo difícil (o sería más pertinente un modo normal, llamando dificultad historia a la aventura actual, aunque lo del nombre es lo de menos)

una auténtica maravilla de videojuego, jugarlo en steam deck no tiene precio. mejora todo lo que tiene su precuela, de lo mejor de este año sin lugar a dudas si el rpg clasico japones es vuestro rollo.

with beautiful graphics and one of the best ost i've heard, it improves on everything from the first one, with a deeper and more strategic combat and with much more endearing characters and stories than the first one.

best jrpg of this year, a deep combat system with a lot of customization that encourages experimentation, beautiful graphics and fantastic ost and stories and characters much better carried than in the previous one.
expands and improves on the first game in nearly every way. goty for me, the epilogue especially knocked it out of the park.
tag this game. i'm preparing to play this game, but i haven't started playing yet. i'm just tagging this game so that i can find it easily when i play it in the future.

octo ii has a great narrative. the stories are interesting, mostly. some are more boring then others. the stories are the main element for this game. the fighting is pure jrpg turn based. some boss fights require some specials powers. the level of difficulty become a real grind at level 18, and in that sens, there is a lot of grinding when you arrive at the chapter 2 of each character, and chapter 3 is even more higher in terms of level. i don't feel like there is a natural way of levelling except grind. which i found dull to no measure. the sounds are pretty good. the graphics are also very nice for a semi 2d game. i give it 72%. i liked the game, not so much the level of difficulty.

wow. an immersive game world. not just an immersive game, but an immersive game world. the next gen hd-2d graphics create a world that looks like a game world. this game world looks greats and seems alive. you know you're out of the real world and into a classic game world (but with better graphics). there is not just one story, but eight individual stories plus the overall story. the writing is good. each character is distinctive. for example, one character is a dancer who wants to bring smiles to the world! i've never seen anything like that before. it's nice to see happy characters who want to bring joy to the world. yet, there's also a thief character, who says "heh, heh" as she steals from townspeople. this is the first time i've experienced this combat based on a break the enemy system. the game runs smoothly on my pc, never a game performance problem. in sum, a top quality game by square enix's currently best (or one of the best) developers, team asano. note: you don't need to have played octopath traveller the original in order to play this one.

lol. niche game. and now a niche company. cannot believe the audacity of trying to pass off this game at 60$ and calling its ridiculous lack of texture detail an artistic decision, instead of what it really is, which is a cop out on putting real effort into a game. avoid at all costs.

sure if youre dumb enough to spend 2023 cash on a 1990 style game go for it “if” the game didnt put you to sleep immediately it might have been worth 19$ it doesnt even do that. this price and release from se is honestly pathetic. id rather try forspoken again then acknowledge this game exists
60$ for a game that cost 5$ and one dev a month to make

like the first game, the sequel is underdeveloped and overpriced. it is just a very generic jrpg. it has improved but the price tag is still far higher than it is worth. square enix like many other publishers constantly burn their resources then expect the customers to pay for overpriced products like this to make up for their incompetence. would have given the game 6/10 if it was less than 8$.

gris is a breathtakingly beautiful experience — more art piece than traditional game. the visuals are absolutely mesmerizing, with every frame looking like a watercolor painting come to life. the puzzles are simple yet elegant, blending seamlessly into the emotional journey rather than interrupting **** music ties everything together with haunting, emotional tracks that rise and fall with the story’s tone. gris is a serene, visually stunning experience from start to finish.
un juego demasiado bonito, muy corto pero impacta mucho. se disfruta con todo
gameplay gets boring at times, but the art direction, music and puzzles are consistently stunning. **** love this game so much omg it's just so artistic
visually beautiful and unique, gameplay is not interesting, and isn't worth while. would probably have worked better as some kind of short animation film.
the art style of this game is nothing but breathtaking. the whole game is like a beautiful dream, very relaxing. a hidden masterpiece!

i wanted to play neva and since gris was really cheap i just decided to give it a try before buying it. i didn't come with much expectations but i almost cried at the end, the art direction is fantastic and the music is truly one of the best from an indie game. i find it a little short even as a journey fan, i think that it could've been a little bit longer, especially with what the story is truly about. as for the simplicity of the gameplay, i think it suits the game quite nicely but i get that puzzles and platforming isn't for everyone.

gris is a peaceful game. i love it. graphic art style is a masterpiece and music is insane! the story is conceptual and the gameplay has simple but worthy features mechanic. its totally enjoyable, of course its short and some level environment are confusing a bit. but anyway i give it a complete score because it's what "the game is an art" means.
the gameplay is merely adequate, but the stunning water colour visuals and beautiful soundtrack ensure that gris is a memorable experience.

beautiful, creative and relaxing game (the music is so good and works together with the excellent design. gameplay can be boring in some parts, but i think that this game is not something you play to have fun, this is something you play to relax your mind and appreciate art

profound story on loss and recovery which may be interpreted differently by players. simple mechanics: nice learning curve and lots of good ideas in the puzzles. great art style: both graphics and sounds. a relaxing game, not too challenging. personal warning: the themes could trigger some individuals, about sadness.

the feeling of being stuck in what feels like a lifeless, emotionless, and completely uncaring world, where your voice and feelings mean nothing, is a feeling that i unfortunately believe many (if not all) people in this world have felt. whether it's a feeling manifested by loss, disappointment, anger, a chemical imbalance in your brain, disease, depression, or any of the other thousands of reasons is ultimately irrelevant. the point is that most people have felt this feeling in their own unique way. gris starts with that exact feeling. a character that sees no colour in the world, no life, no meaning, and no voice of her own, with trials and tribulations designed in a way that actively set her back, trying to impede her progress. gameplay-wise, many of these obstacles are very easy to deal with. however, metaphorically, whenever gris overcomes these setbacks, she heals a tiny bit of her psyche. more and more life, colour, and joy is brought back into her world, which is beautifully realised with both the gorgeous art design and a sublime soundtrack composed by the band berlinist. and while i don't believe every idea present in this game is 100% cohesive, nor do i believe the gameplay is all that engaging or well intertwined with the story, the game is still a sublime work of art and an impressive debut from nomada studio.

i got this because it was by devolver digital, a mistake. boring, pretentious, criptic in a bad way, slow, intentionally padded to enlengthen it for no reason other than showcase the graphics and artwork that honestly are nothing to be amazed at. i felt nothing more than regret while playing this.
when i was 7, my late uncle dimytro used to make me shovel pig manure all day on his farm. even then, i had more fun than playing this game.
you will not play until the last 15% of the game, for 85% you do nothing but hold forward and do a few of the most basic jumps possible.

ok... if i could give -10 it would be now... in this game there is no challenge you only walk straight and jump... and no you can not die... there is no goal... no rules... no purpose... no challenge... is simply boring... it is a waste of money (30 usd) that you could spend in something else (like a real game). i would understand this ""thing"" as a flash online free game but (i repeat) 30 usd for basically less than 3 hours absolutely not... and do not come at me with the sad story of the protagonist... adding a sad story to a character does not condone for making **** and pass it for a videogame. period. oh and also guess what... you have android or huawei... well you cant play this game... only for iphone and ipad... this makes me even more angry... like who the f*uk uses apple anymore... edit: i forgot to say that if you want to know the history of the protagonist you have to go on the wiki because there are no dialogues and from the game itself you can't understand the story i am sorry if i made any mistakes english is not my first language i am italian
a pretty art piece, but a severly lacking video game.

i know why journalists loved this garbage - it's barely even a game. for my brief time playing, i held the control stick to the right and maybe hit the jump button a few dozen times. it's an art project that results from sniffing one's own farts for way too long. just make an animated short next time and don't try to charge $15 for this awful pretend-game.
boldly reinvents the series with turn-based combat. pacing and grind can be an issue but it’s full of charm.

a história desse jogo é muito boa, nesse sentido, manteve o nível de entradas anteriores. todos os personagens são muito interessantes e vivos, com características únicas. o grande problema desse jogo, para mim, fica em algumas partes do combate. a batalha contra os chefões não são muito divertidas, acabam se tornando extremamente longas e repetitivas. talvez seja uma limitação do estilo de combate por turno, porém isso teve um impacto negativo para mim em determinados momentos do jogo. considerando tudo, foi um ótimo jogo, o universo é muito vivo e existem inúmeras atividades para fazer além da história principal. inclusive, existem tantas coisas para fazer, que o jogo acaba se tornando grande e demorado até demais. para quem é muito fã, certamente consegue ficar centenas de horas sem enjoar.

yakuza: like a dragon ist ein fantastischer startpunkt für alle, die neu in die yakuza-welt eintauchen wollen. das spiel bricht mit traditionen und liefert ein einzigartiges erlebnis. der neue held, ichiban kasuga, ist einfach gold wert. sein grenzenloser optimismus und seine "golden retriever"-energie sind unglaublich sympathisch und geben der story eine ganz besondere note. die geschichte ist packend und tiefgründig. auch wenn sich das erzähltempo manchmal etwas zieht, lohnt es sich, dranzubleiben – die charaktere und wendungen sind es wert. besonders hervorzuheben ist das gameplay: der wechsel zu rundenbasierten kämpfen ist überraschend witzig und macht einfach spaß. es ist eine erfrischende abwechslung, die dem spiel seinen ganz eigenen charme verleiht. yakuza: like a dragon ist ein absolutes highlight – ein einzigartiges jrpg mit herz, humor und einem unvergesslichen protagonisten. sehr empfehlenswert!
yakuza: like a dragon gets 93 wario points from i, the wario enthusiast. this is a wario worthy game
superb story and good gameplay. fighting can get a little bit boring after a while. but overall a nice game and a big surprise.

they took a huge risk changing the genre as well as the iconic protagonist but for me they did it with flying colors pros: -unique and fun combat the turn based aspect allows them to go wild with their imaginations..nuclear bombs,dragons and a lot of goofy stuff along with it -great cast that develops a lot because of ichiban -ichiban is a great protagonist that could get overly cheesy at points but still enjoyable cons: -towards the end you will reach a heavy wall which requires you to grind a lot before trying the boss again

one of my favorite yakuza games, even though it changed from beat em up to turn based i didn't really mind because everything else was top tier, maybe the best in the franchise, the substories, characters, minigames, story and so on, play it.
instead of there being fat to cut down, i wish there were more fat in this game. the small things here and there lowered the score, but it's a delightful experience.

it was my first yakuza game. at first, i wasn't convinced by the storytelling style, but once i got used to it, i couldn't put the game down. i've tried to platinum the game, but one achievement was hard to get, so i ultimately gave up on it. really great game. recently i've bought a bundle with 7 yakuza games (from yakuza 0 to yakuza 6) so i have plans for at least a year.
a legitemate 10/10 video game experience. the best rpg ever made, hands down.

transition from beat em up to jrpg style might seem skeptical at first, but if you spend 1-2hours you will understand why people call the change a success. changing the genre also fits the protagonist. since kiryu is a strong beast of a character who deals with his problem alone where as iciban, who is just your average yakuza that needs help from his friends to overcome the challenges he faces.

i can't believe how dumb this game is. how did the series fall from a legend like kiryu to a child's story like ichban? i highly recommend this game to anyone with severe brain damage.
i love the rpg elements in this game. they're well excecuted. i also love ichiban. all my homies love ichiban. can't wait for yakuza 8

what a disappointment, i love yakuza games, especially yakuza 0. but yakuza dragon is just bad and boring, it's sad to says. i love rpg & turn based games but it's just really bad on this game. and all the crazy outfits, weapons etc just ****, we are not in saints row.

this game is a mixed bag but overall it's a banal excuse of a yakuza game when taken into account the other 7 games in the series. we go from the legends and high level yakuza glory and drama with a kiryu of dignified tragic grandeur and the other legends and their stories to childlike **** and bums with endless ui and dialogue that just crawls along. gag. the writers love orphans, they love surrogate paternal relationships, they love all types of perversions and all sorts of videogame culture, we get it this is just over the top and does not fit in very well with the series as a whole. i don't play turn based combat games, it's too automatic and too ui heavy i prefer control over the experience as much as possible with the least ui in the way. one aspect of why i've played and replayed 0-6 is that it's not turn based. this is serviceable but i did not play dragon quest so the references mean nothing to me. ichiban seems to shout his lines rather than speak and it sounds like he's on drugs lol. the larger maps are pretty empty and generic, even reworked from y4/y5 to my eye. i think y6 was about 40gb, this monster is 60gb and for what? so they can shout ma more! bloated. the back stories are just not believable, although that's true for most yakuza games to be fair. this game would have benefit by being shorter and more personal and detailed and being more yakuza focused rather than all the other characters etc that have absolutely no ya-ku-za whatsoever. over-rated. garrish. perverted. banal.
отличная игра местами графика очень радует но местами есть мыльцо, но не так сильно бросается в глаза, а так игра отличная!
ı hate turn based combat system it doesn't fit the nature of yakuza games.
i spent hours watching this entire game. the cut scenes are glorious and never ending. my only recommendation would be to watch this game via youtube because it has better optimization.

esse é literalmente o melhor jogo ja criado!primeira vez em anos q n choro em um jogo, primeira vez q n consigo me divertir tanto com uma mecânica! ignorem completamente quem diz que é apenas um "jogo de uma robô sexy" o jogo é muito mais que isso, essa parte é apenas de design de personagem. comprem, joguem,dêem uma chance, depois meagradeçam
apart from its mediocre port, it has one of the greatest endings in gaming history

mind blowing story and themes wrapped up in mid graphics and great art with fun, impressive beat them all and bullet hell gameplay. the multiple ending structure might be tedious to get through at times, but it's definitely worth the time given how the first ending only scratches the surface of what it wants to tell. went in skeptical of the hype and came out an absolute fan of what they've done with the game.
philosophical depth meets stylish combat. occasionally uneven pacing and level design keep it from true greatness.
kam wegen 2b's gyaaat, blieb für die philosophische achterbahnfahrt und ging mit gebrochenem herzen und der erkenntnis, dass roboter mehr fühlen als ich.

i feel like i'm missing something, because despite the intriguing setting, story and vibes, i couldn't help but feel frustrated by the core game-play. the meaningless side-quests, the constant back-tracking and the somewhat dull combat really hold this game back imo.

10/10 character design 10/10 soundtrack 10/10 ui 10/10 story what is not 10/10? the controls in pc. there's no problem if you're playing with controller (i've tried both!) :3 if you completed nier automata, you must replay it again in order to get the true grasp on what's going on. the first ending is just the tip of the iceberg.i am mainly into the ui design and the soundtrack, hisayoshi kijima is really killing this one, with both aesthetic and unique aspect of it. and don't forget the character animations! really unique and ughhhh.. appealing! i love you developerrrrrss 10/10 overall.

jogo excelente, belos gráficos, ótima história e jogabilidade bem fluida. contém muitas missões secundárias que ampliam o conteúdo do jogo, que possuí diversos finais. simplesmente imperdível, um dos melhores jogos de todos os tempos.

i didn't like the game in the first hours and then when the story came into play i loved the game (great story). the only boring thing is that you have to finish the game 2-3 times, they should have combined them all directly.

i don't hate it, but i do feel the level of praise it's getting, i.e. compare to elden ring, breath of the wild etc as a potentially top tier rpg hack n slash is a bit laughable i will caveat that i'm about 5-10 hours in, and have heard lots of good things about the story, however honestly i don't really care about stories anyway unless they're unbelievable and unique. so far this feels a bit pretentious and isn't really resonating with me hate the autosave mechanic, derives from dark souls but worse and adds nothing. the map is also awful, trying to force exploration but within quite an empty, uninteresting world the map design is also very poor. i have spent up to an hour in several areas just trying to find stuff, leave areas or having to re-tread steps enemy design has very little variety and for the first 5 hours it felt like most enemies were damage sponges (although that is improving now) tldr: pros: -good visuals, although not amazing -combat does look cool at times -interesting premise -music is good at some points and quite unique cons: -very unintuitive -story is hit or miss, and is heavily pushed in a very japenese manga style, which can hugely drag pacing -not a fan of sexualizing the main character. feels very creepy being able to look up your characters skirt with animations / movements built in by design

nier: automata is a masterclass in game design, combining thrilling hack-and-slash combat, a thought-provoking narrative, and an unforgettable soundtrack. the combat system offers a perfect blend of speed and strategy, with the ability to switch between weapon types and utilize pod programs for endless combat possibilities. the story explores deep existential themes through complex characters like 2b, 9s, and a2, with multiple endings that enhance replayability. the post-apocalyptic world is richly detailed, creating an immersive atmosphere that complements the game's themes. the soundtrack by keiichi okabe perfectly captures the emotional tone, enhancing both combat and exploration. while the voice acting is sparse and some cutscenes lack visual consistency, these are minor flaws in an otherwise exceptional experience. nier: automata challenges, inspires, and leaves a lasting impression, offering a unique and rewarding journey.
i wont even begin to try to understand why japanese gamedev is like this. this is just sad.

storia e narrazione molto convincente . molto intuitivo capire cosa bisogna fare, fin dai primi minuti di gioco. le movenze del gatto sono un qualcosa di unico . molto bello il rapporto tra il gatto e i robot che incontra , sopratutto la sua mascotte che spesso risulta indispensabile per progredire nella storia. molto bella l’idea di creare una lingua incomprensibile , ma grazie al traduttore è tutto molto comprensibile anche in italiano . saltare sui tetti , per capire come raggiungere alcuni luoghi , alla ricerca di oggetti o aiuti non risulta noioso. il suono e le ambientazioni sono ben curate ed esplorare è sempre un piacere sia per gli occhi che per la mente . capire cosa fare risulta semplice , farlo , delle volte necessita ingegno ed investigazione , anche se non troppo difficile. molto belle anche le situazionid’azione , dove bisogna correre , saltare e successivamente anche eliminare i nemici con un’arma costruita dagli amici robot. un gioco come questo mi ha piacevolmente lasciato sorpreso. giocato su un mac mini m2pro al massimodella qualità grafica a1920 x 1080 sempre fluido . purtroppo in un solo caso il gioco si è bloccato. consiglio a tutti coloro che amano esplorare , ragionare e vivere una storia ben narrata , ma che odino quel genere di giochi dove bisogna spesso sparare. finalmente un gioco che si discosta dal solito genere spara salta e corri.

a wonderful game with a great story and graphics. it was truly enjoyable to play, and i'm happy to say it was the best game i've ever played. by the end, i couldn't stop crying. i honestly recommend it.

maría se que estas viendo esto, porfavor, dejame ver a los niños, ya te pague la pension, porfavor, tambien son mis hijos , solo esta navidad pd: este juego es buenardo eh, 10/10, gracias stray por hacerme un hombre de bien y ver por lo demas, la premisa es clave y te llena el corazon de un amor por estos lindos y peludos animales llamados gatos ️
a different style, i loved it. even though the storytelling is weak in some places, this game... this game will always hold a special place in my heart.

stray is a good game that ends too quick imo 8 hour run time is not enough for the price point at the time of my review ($30) hauntingly beautiful soundtrack, environments, and story will keep you engaged and craving more

the game is pretty short, but that’s actually a good thing — it doesn’t get boring. the story is simple and short, but still interesting. you want to see what happens next, even if some parts are predictable. there are also a few side quests, like collecting things or helping someone. there aren’t too many of them, so they don’t get annoying. the atmosphere is amazing — 10 out of 10. the soundtrack is great too. the graphics are nice and pleasant. the gameplay is fun, and it’s especially enjoyable just walking around as a cat in these beautiful locations. the puzzles aren’t hard, but sometimes you can end up stuck somewhere with no easy way **** ending was really sad. this is the first game that actually made me tear up at the end. i definitely recommend trying it, but it’s a good idea to watch a review first — in case puzzles and adventures in an underground neon-lit city full of robots aren’t your thing.(not my translate)
stray is an absolutely beautiful game. i also love the cyberpunk aesthetic.

ill put this game a 10/10 because i loved it. game looks amazing, very beautiful, cute, many interesting and good things about cat. plot in this game is great, atmosphere also. sometimes its scary sometimes its funny, but most of the time it is really interesting and great

a game that knows what it aims to be, and does just that with quality and polish. it doesn't over-promise, and it doesn't overstay its welcome. a neat package, a bite-sized adventure well worth its asking price.
despite its unique premise, the game suffers from shallow gameplay, dull puzzles, and a lackluster story.

stray es un juego con un potencial que no alcanza. la base de todo es la fantasía de jugar como un gato, pero al final más que hacer eso lo que tienes es un walking simulator donde el personaje es un gato pero mucho de lo que haces no es lo que haría un gato. añade al walking simulator algo de diálogo para crear una historia super básica y genérica, algunos puzzles tan sencillos que llamarlos puzzles es una exageración y algunas secciones un poco más ágiles y más o menos tienes el juego. lo que quedaría es la parte de exploración para encontrar objetos ocultos y así pero esa parte en general es floja, siendo las zonas muy pequeñas en su mayoría.gráficamente el juego está bastante bien ejecutado, especialmente el gato está fantástico, pero a mi a nivel estético me acabó cansando mucho. el sonido es más bien flojo, con unos efectos escasos y repetitivos, y una música poco presente y que en general mejor sin ella. y el juego tiene importantes bugs, causando reinicios de ordenador e incluso llegué a un punto en que hay que hablar con un pnj y no quería, siendo imposible avanzar en el juego y me dio demasiada pereza volver a empezarlo (probé a reempezar el capítulo y mismo problema) así que no pude acabarlo y eso que es un juego muy corto (tiene un logro para hacerlo en menos de 2 **** resultado, en mi opinión, es una oportunidad perdida. un 4.

oh qu’il est mignon le minou ! et rare en plus… parce qu’un rouquin tigré comme ça, j’en ai jamais vu… mais le voici perdu dans une ville abandonnée… mais qui peut devenir hostile, car elle n’est pas abandonnée par tout le monde ou plutôt par tous ces bidules ici et là !lesquels vous sautent dessus… et là, c’est le drame ! et du coup, ils ont gâché leur gentil simulateur de promenade, c’est ballot quand même… ils l’ont gâché avec ces saloperies et en même temps des sortes d’énigmes pour s’en sortir, je **** qui somnolais gentiment devant ce truc assez dépaysant, ma foi -et fort joliment fait en plus. la patte artistique est là, servie par une technique pas mal du tout en fait. moi qui somnolais à moitié donc, car le simulateur de promenade est propice à la somnolence, forcément. et voilà qu’ils me font chier avec leurs peluches enragées qui sautent et tuent mon chat !!et là, c’est le drame ! désinstallation immédiate et note-sanction en guise de punition (et inversement). mais j’irai jusqu’à deux quand même, oui deux points, car il ne faut point être trop sévère non plus. quand même. ils ont tout gâché, la promenade est foutue, retour à la maison, mon chaton !
best puzzle game ever. atmosphere, story, and characters are done so incredibly well. must play the game for literally everyone. 10/10
extremely fun game, with puzzle solving and a great story being told at the same time, this makes it a game worth playing if you enjoy storytelling and puzzles.
one of the best pc games to exist. an incredible sequel to portal 1 with more humour and a great cast of characters.

los de valve siempre han sido y seran los mejores en hacer secuelas, esta no es la excepcion, es una obra maestra en: personajes, diseño de niveles, lore, humor; y esto incluye los dialogos, acciones y desciciones de los personajes, las voces me encantan tanto en español como en ingles. spoiler alert que wheatley se vuelva malo pero es muy estupido y vuelva todo mierda, y tenemos que hacer una tregua con glados que nos termina uniendo mas y descubrimos que ella era la esposa del fundador de aperture, y todo lo que descubrimos de los origenes de aperture y los portales y nos transporta a una epoca mas antigua de todo. despues de derrotar a wheatly y al final le cedemos el control a glados y nos termina salvando de quedar en el espacio, y al final glados tiene su redencion, y al final wheatly tambien tiene su redencion, y que glados elimine a caroline de su mente o algo asi, porque al final glados es glados y ella es perfecta y tiene sentimientos y es mas humana que muchos personajes de otros videojuegos. es simplemente **** una obra maestra en todos los sentidos, no falla tecnicamente en nada, simplemente juegalo para verlo y comprobarlo todo tu mismo, habia veces que cargaba partida a proposito solo para volver a escuchar los dialogos de los personajes, que putisima obra **** probe el modo cooperativo pero de seguro que tambien es una obra maestra. te amo portal 2 te amo, esta vez, glados te amo valve siempre innovando siempre haciéndome feliz y siempre adelantado a su época.

если и играть, то только с дополнениями, которые невероятных размеров, особенно hamlet. добавляют очень много в игру, а дополнение с гигантнами и вовсе нужно было сделать как основную игру. так или иначе очень интересная и годная выживалка, в которой ты ещё и можешь настроить свой мир как тебе захочется. редко в каких играх про выживание такое есть. в принципе, в игре можно залипнуть, и это наверное первая игра, в жанре выживание, которая мне понравилась. в игре даже сюжет есть, который можно пройти в "особом" режиме, который сложнее, чем вся игра. в общем, она точно заслуживает внимания.

it's honestly a pretty good survival game. craft your base, make food, hunt a little bit. the random map generation is really nice and there are quite a lot of settings you can tweak if you want. my biggest negative is the combat. it is clunky and hitboxes are sometimes way off, and you kind of have to do combat at some point as after a while, some creatures will start to actively hunt you.
